description:
Long time, small Hookah/tea lounge tucked away in the Tenderloin. Intimate ambience. The house tea made with milk rivals some of the best Pakistani/Indian chai I've had- a must try. 

Hookah- 3.5 stars
A good quality Khalil Mamoon base- but hose tubing is plastic-corrugated but had a decent pull. (A rubber hose with metal end would be better)  Comes with three coals- a bit harsh, I had to take off two of the coals- for a slower better burn. (Ask for tongs).

House tea (ORDER IT WITH MILK!)- 5 stars 
Unbelievable- it's Chai- and quite possibly one of the best chai's I've ever tasted. Perfect for chilly SF evenings. 

Random fact: This is where I lost my hookah virginity over 15 years ago. It's been around that long. That kind of longevity for shops like this is becoming harder to find these days.
author: Sami A.

description: This place is a great hole in the wall to relax and enjoy alone or with friends. Great ambience, crowd, music, and selection.
author: Mariam J.

description:
Aside from being an obvious hookah lounge, this place serves the best tea ever. I seem to always Uber from the other side of SF, when I'm in the city, to get my tea fix. They will never give you the recipe, but I ask all the time anyway.

When it's slow, the people working are willing to play your song preferences if you ask. Score!

The bathroom here gets 0 stars. It's disgusting and never stocked with anything; soap, toilet paper, toilet seat covers, or paper towels. They will, however, stock up when you ask them to. But fear not, they have a sink in their corner so the employees clearly wash their hands.
author: Love K.

description:
This place was terrible. Limited hookah menu and their bathroom was disgusting! I went in and noticed there weren't any tissues so I asked the employee for one and instead of going in there and putting it in himself (and perhaps clean up a bit too),  he just hands the roll to me. Like what? 

Save your money. Not worth it.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
They are reasonably priced than most hookah bars in the city!

Their tea is decent too.

But they always leave the door open which makes the place soo cold! I only hate that about this place!
author: Deebs M.

description:
Mohammad and EB thanks mate!!!! 3 tables outside, 4-4tops inside, many 2 tops inside maybe 8+ Music was slapping!!!!!

First time here Friday 1am and there was about  3 tables sat. Mohammad friendly greeted me and my friends and sat us. 

We ordered the Obama which cost $25 plus tax. We really enjoyed our stay because Mohammad demonstrated some smoke tricks, as well as, regularly changed our coals.

I see myself coming back here with friends. 
Thanks for the great service!!!

#JrayEats
author: Jray M.

description: Pretty disappointed after coming here. I'm guessing San Fran isn't really big on hookah bars because it was almost impossible to find some decent hookah bars around here. After desperately searching, we decided to come to this place. Their hookah menu is very limited and they only use coconara coals which i thought was kind of weird. I ended up ordering and the hookah they brought out to us didn't come with a clean pipe, you have to request it and pay a little extra for it. Here in the DC area giving people a new pipe is a given. Well we asked for a new pipe and started smoking. The hookah was good for about 10 minutes and after that it got really harsh and would burn my throat. I didn't have a pair of tongs to change the coals myself so I had to wait for one of the workers to come by so I could ask him. The service is kind of slow but not too bad. Another thing that I noticed is that it states on their menu that they only change your coals twice and thats it. I'm not sure if this is something common in the area or if its just that hookah bar but i have never heard of any hookah bar putting a limit as to how many coals you're allowed to have. Well it turned out that there was no need for a change of coals because we ended up leaving cause our hookah was so bad. Despite the hookah being terrible, the servers are very nice.
author: Nargis A.

description: Super expensive for nothing special. Dirty ass bathroom ... and I believe this place is owned by Muslim. Cleanliness is next to Godliness. Not a big variety of flavors but the Obama was good.
author: Khadeejah S.

description:
This is actually the worst hookah bar I've ever been to. 

First of all it's TINY--we came as a group of about 10 people and the only place for us to sit was at the cramped bench area next to the door (we were on the verge of sitting on top of each others laps lmfao). This place is definitely more for smaller groups of 2-4 people and nothing more. Secondly, the service here is TERRIBLE. Apparently there is a rule that one hookah must be shared between two people. But the problem is not everyone in our group wanted to hookah, we just wanted to chill together, but they said we HAD to order a hookah between two people...that's 5 hookahs (each ~$20+) are you kidding me? We tried to kick a deal to order 2 hookahs and some tea for our group but the guy wouldn't even let us do that. This place is ridiculous and not chill at all. If you're thinking of coming here with a big group just don't bother
author: Christy W.

description: This is still the best hookah lounge in town! Nice music, great hookah and awesome tea. Simple and a wonderful place to relax. If you want to hang with your friends and enjoy a hookah this is best place for a great value.
author: Christopher F.

description: Great tea amazing tea and their Obama flavor hits for hours on top of hours. And the young gentleman who work their are very nice
author: Laid C.

description: This place is so fun and chill! The employees are awesome and love having fun with the customers. They recognized me by the 2nd time I was in there! If I'm ever in SF in the evening, looking for a spot, this place is my go to! Also can't forget their delicious tea :)
author: Angela M.

description:
Hookah (reviewed by a friend) - had to pay extra for additional coal ($4 for two coal?!) when it burned off.

I bought a mojito for $5 which was literally a mint leaf in sprite. 

Very disappointing. I don't mind paying for quality, but I don't want to be paying for nothing.
author: Raakin H.

description: This place perfect for chilling out with guys. Awesome hookahs. Something really unique about the hookahs is they burn for an hour easily and they don't use coals. They use some secret stuff guy explained but I can't write his secret. That thing doesn't hurt ur throat at all. To end good smoke you should order the Great Turkish coffee. Very reasonable pricing. Actually cheap by SF standards.
author: Ninad N.

description:
total rip. prices - ridiculously high. accommodations (compared to standards established by other hookah lounges) - extremely weak. smoke - extremely run of the mill. 

been to many a hookah lounge. worst prices and set up i've experienced.
author: Tyler D.

description:
What sold me was the fact that this hookah bar isn't so smokey! Considering that this place is pretty small, I definitely did not feel suffocated with all the hookah smoke. Awesome place to hang out with friends while listening to great music (music playlist is awesome). Tobacco wasn't harsh at all which was great, no headaches or light headedness! 

Between 4 people, we ordered two pots of tea and it was soooo good! Perfect addition to smoking hookah.
author: Shela D.

description: Hookah is ok. But the management rejected to take a request for a change of music. Kept playing some lame tracks from the 90's. Even when my group was the only one present there. Disappointing. Horrible service. Will never go back. Laguna Cafe is way better in service and hookah than this horrible place.
author: ShoAib S.

description:
I have been to this place so many times to have fun with my friends after drinks for Hookah and everything goes as good as usual. Lately, i went with 3 of my friends and only
2 were going to smoke hookah and the others were getting hot beverages. To our surprise, they asked our friends who are not smoking hookah to pay $10 charge for no getting hookah!!!!! Which makes no sense and the server was rude about it, he didn't care for loosing customers.
author: Gina T.

description:
A small, cozy hookah lounge on Jones street. The decor is cool and they offer a great milk tea. Selection of shisha flavors is alright, but man they char it every time. Getting replacement coals is a struggle (staff is very inattentive) and the pricing is not competitive for the quality.

During my last visit I also noticed a massive splotch of black mold on the ceiling, calling the cleanliness of the whole place into question.

Nile will do the job if you really want a hookah - but it's far from ideal.
author: Irina P.

description: Not much seating, overpriced, and semi-sucky service. We got kicked from our spot so that a larger group could sit where we were...insteAd of having them wait or putting them somewhere else, without any sorry or compensation of some sort (e.g., discounted bill) especially since we had to ask twice for coal change because they forgot when we first asked!
author: Natasha K.

description: I can call myself somewhat a regular here, I've been to this place around 10 times, and my experience has been pretty much the same every time. Their space is small, so it usually gets packed by 11PM on Friday/Saturday. Good hooka flavors, not too many options for tea, they ones they have are pretty average and too sweet at times. Their service depends on who your server is, sometimes okay-ish other times great. Usually they have arabic music playing on Fridays and sometimes take song requests.  Their bathroom is really tiny and mostly dirty, but looking at the size of the cafe I'm just glad they have one.
author: Reema B.

description:
This is what you call a shit show. 

Packed as hell on a Friday night, my friend and I walk in and ask for a table for 2 and we're sat right near the door. 15 mins goes by and someone says do you want to order and we're like, can we have a menu? We just order mint hookah without opening it up. Now another 15-20 mins go by and our hookah hasn't came. We asked the guy 4-5 times where it was and he runs back confused and places the order. 5-10 mins later we get a shit hookah, in a hot/humid room even with the door open. They are cash only too, stay as far away from this place as possible. 

You're better off walking down Jones St to the heart of the TL and taking in the second hand smoke if you know what i mean lawlz.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
I can smell the hookah almost everyday when I walk by so I decided to go there and truly it out as it seems like an ok spot. Let me tell you this place is so small you can't make a U turn. So I ordered one of the hookah flavor that the employees recommended. The hookah was ok nothing special actually it gave me a headache it must be from all the hookah smoke inside the place 
It gets overwhelming after a short time.
If you go there I suggest an outside table.
author: Veronica L.

description: Mediocre hookah cafe in the middle of the city. Good place to stop for some hookah if you want to stay close to bars and restaurants nearby. Their Jasmin tea was pretty good. We tried the Nile mix, it wasnt as good as the staff told us it was. The hookah was actually pretty harsh even after they tried to make it better. Dmitri is great and takes good care of his guests. If you sit in their outdoor seating area expect to get approached by bums, prostitutes, and general street hustlers lookin for a come up. The staff does everything they can to make them leave and prevent them from coming back but theres really so much they can do. It is San Francisco so you kind of get that just about evey where you go in the city.
author: Vince N.

description:
THANK THE LORD THEY REPLACED THE BATHROOM DOOR.

Also we are recognized as regulars now, so the service has improved markedly.  This is nice, in fact they remember our order as well, so we don't even really have to say much when we arrive.

The music can be kind of a mixed bag, sometimes it's middle eastern (Egyptian?) music videos, one of the last time we were there, though it was wall to wall Taylor Swift.  I can't really complain, who among us doesn't love a little Tay Tay from time to time?  It was just a bit of an unexpected departure.

They also did a bit of a renovation recently which had them make more efficient use of their space; they can accommodate many more parties without the space feeling more crowded, so that is good.
author: Rachel S.

description: cool spot, but can only eat outside food in their outdoor area.  verysmall too but i like it.
author: Tasha D.

description:
This hole in the wall spot does not represent anything great that you love about hookah. My small group of four were the first ones in on a Sunday night, but we waited over 20 mins. after two more groups that came after us got their hookahs before us.  If you read other recent reviews you'll see the same thing I'm about to say:
- They're always out of flavors (took us 3 tries).
- Not only are their hoses these cheap little vacuum extensions, but their hookahs are so cheap they use paper towels for proper seal (pictured).
- The service is the worst. Oh let me count the ways.  I had to tell the cashier how to use his own register to split the bill which he emphatically insisted couldn't be done.  It could.
- The "service" has to be the rudest, most unprofessional service you'll receive anywhere for anything.  Case in point: one of us asked for sugar for tea.  The guy grabbed a sugar shaker, turned it upside down to see if sugar poured which it didn't, and then gave it to my friend.  "Does this work?  No?  I'll give it to 'em anyway."  
- Their cup ware is dirty and CHIPPED like crazy.  
- Did I mention the service sucks?

Skip this abysmal disgrace.
author: Nick J.

description: We usually like to get "The Obama" which has very good and sweet flavor. The service and music is good.
author: Manish K.

description:
Best hookah spot in the city! Great staff.
Good tea too!
Mango is THE BEST! (Mango the manager, not the flavor )
author: Lisa M.

description: Love this place. Hookahs are pretty good and the tea is the bomb. I get a pitcher of the house tea and the Obama (not sure if that's how you spell it) flavored hookah.
author: Tony S.

description: Have you ever walked into a place and instantly realized you entered an alternate world of absolute trash? That's this place in a nutshell. Overpriced garbage.
author: Daniel A.

description: The gentleman serving is here is so nice. Get a pot of their black tea it is delicious! And the hookah is very very good!
author: Sarah E.

description: Super rude. Refused service to my friend and I even though they were clearly still open. We arrived at 1 and they state their hours until 2. We promised to smoke and be out diligently but they adamantly refused us even though there were other customers inside
author: Briana G.

description:
Best chai tea in the city!!!

Now lets get to the hookah part. 
Hookah here was fabulous. We sat outside & puffed until we choked on the mint chocolate/strawberry concoction we had smoked. Lovely. Super crowded on a Wednesday night so the service was on the slow side. 

Met the owner who is very polite, professional & accommodating.

The flavor choices are intriguing. Next time ill try the Obama!

Cash only- ATM inside for fee of $2.50.
author: Court S.

description: I love this place! It's my favorite place for hookah in SanFrancisco! The people who work there are really cool, kind, and helpful!
author: Husam A.

description: Wonderful small, chilled out hookah bar with fantastic flavors and well prepared hookahs. Visiting here from Michigan and this kicks the crap out of every hookah bar back home. We ordered a bowl of "Obama" sheesh and two Chai Lattes. Both are fan- fucking- tastic. Only thing missing is a comfy seat.
author: Brain W.

description:
I pity people who've been hit with the stupid stick. 

You know, the idiot at the office who stands in front of the printer asking "Why isn't this fax going through?" Or the cashier at the grocery store who looks at your ahi tuna steaks and says, "I never knew 'Ahi Tuna' is a breed of cow". Or when you ask for a half dozen eggs and the response you get is "It doesn't come in half dozen, just a pack of 6 or 12." WTF?!?!? If I didn't feel so guilt-ridden afterwards, I would try to slap the stupid out of these people. 

Just where do all these stupids end up next on the "corporate ladder"?  Nile Café & Hookah Lounge. Never in my life have I seen such display of horrible customer service from blatantly careless and dumb-as-bricks employees as I did at Nile Café & Hookah Lounge on Friday night. 

10:45 PM - Arrived

10:50 PM - Seated and ordered drinks

11:20 PM - Stupid #1: *Drops off water* "Ohh umm, I forgot to place your drink order."

11:35 PM -
Me: "What flavor is Sweet Sensation?"
Stupid #2: "Sweet."
Me: "What flavor is Sex is on the Beach?"
Stupid #2: "Sweet."
Me: "What flavor is Nile? Oh let me guess, 'Sweet'?"
Stupid #2: "Sweet." *walks away*
Me *thinking*: What the f*ck just happened here?

11:45 PM -
Me: "We want to order Jasmine Mint."
Stupid #1: "We don't have Jasmine Mint."
Me *opens menu and points*: "Jasmine Mint which is also called Paradise."
Stupid #1 *blank look on face*: Ohhh, yes. 

12 Midnight -
Stupid #1: *Comes back with coals and NO hookah* "We don't have Paradise."
Me *clinches fists and looks at friends*: "GIVE ME A F*CKIN' SHOT!"

12:10 AM -
*Manager walks by*
Me: "Excuse me, we've been waiting for 25 minutes for our hookah."
Manager: "Ohh, who helped you?"
Me: "Guy in sandy blonde hair, umm he's a bit..." *bites tongue*
Manager: "Oh, he's high..." *walks off*
Me *clinches fists and looks at friends*: "GIVE ME A F*CKIN' SHOT!"

12:15 AM - *Hookah FINALLY arrives*

12:45 AM -
Stupid #3: "You have to pay now."
Friends: "We still want to order more."
Stupid #3: "But you pay now..."
Friends: "So we have to start a new tab every time we want to order more?"
Stupid #3: "Yes, you pay now..." *hoovers over table until we paid*

ME *clinches fists and looks at friends*: "GIVE ME A F*CKIN' SHOT!"

P.S. - Yes, I AM PMSing. 

OTHER NOTES:
*$20 for each hookah flavor (over 50 regular or mixed flavors)
*Order the House Tea which is like a sweet Armenian Chai tea
*Indoor couch seating and outdoor patio seating (good for people watching)
*Expect to be harassed by druggies and crazies when sitting outside
*CASH ONLY
author: Cherylynn N.

description: It was my first time here with a friend. We asked for peach the guy went to get it and came back to tell us that they don't have it. So we wanted to get strawberry and they didn't have that either. So we had to settle for blueberry. The place was super small!
author: Anahit J.

description:
If I could leave a negative star I would!

Just left this place with a few good friends looking for a good time. We ordered two hookahs to split between four of us and it took them over a half hour to bring them to us on a not so busy night. We also ordered tea. The tea was never brought to us. Because we had two extra people who weren't smoking they told us that we needed to order an extra hookah because it needed to be two hookahs for every two people... Even though the two extra people weren't smoking. The bill was brought to us and they charged us for the tea and got mad that we didn't order an extra hookah. When informed that we never received the tea they told us they couldn't take it off the bill and proceeded to rush to bring us our tea even though we didn't want it anymore and wanted to just leave. The servers and manager were absolutely 100% rude and argued with us the whole time even though we were paying customers. Never coming back to this place again. Rude slow service and not worth it at all.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Greatest thign about this place is the hours. It opens until 4am which is the perfect place to come to after bar hopping until 2 am a couple blocks down. Ambiance is dark but has loud music glaring in the background. Not a hookah expert but I assume prices are decent. We were group of 4 ordered 2 hookahs total came down to $40. So about $10 a head. Hookah flavors were okay. Nothing unique from the flavors you can buy at tobacco shops.
author: Jude N.

description: Open seats three of us, staff puts in the smallest area ask to be move told no. So they rather have empty tables, than paying costumer... Wish I could have tried it.
author: Wanda M.

description:
Never come to this place. I have had the worst service experience ever. You will sit at least 15 till someone takes your order (if you find a place to sit). The seatings are horrible btw.

Their hookah tastes like crap. I have ordered double apple and there was all flavors in it (wtf?) 

In addition, they don't have anything but hookah to serve.

Yuk!
author: Faisal A.

description: Garbage! Hookah was ok..ambience not so much..tiny place..loud music...poor service..overpriced...used to be my go-to place..not anymore
author: Joe D.

description: We've been on a hunt for the perfect hookah bar in San Francisco and this place certainly isn't it. The service is incredibly unprofessional. Though the hookah wasn't bad, we just felt like the servers were ignoring us. There was a 2 people per hookah rule and even though two people from our party of six aren't smokers we were still asked to purchase a hookah between them. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place unless you want to deal with unprofessional people.
author: Shabbir V.

description: One of my favorite hookah bar in the city.its very tiny place but still good atmosphere . They have only one good flavor which called Obama. They really need to work on the other flavors. Customer service is awesome. Ask for mango or ahmed they both great . Friendly.
author: Al-Sheikh Rabby A.

description:
Looking for a chill place to hangout after last call in SF? This is it.

Don't bother calling - they will say they're closed at 2:30am. They say that because it's super busy, to discourage it from getting even more crowded, creating a wait. But it's full, and people are on the move. We waited maybe 15 minutes before a group left and we were able to sit down.

The service is iffy.. we ordered a hookah when the 5 of us were squeezed around the end of a table. BEFORE the group next to us sat down. And yet they got all their hookahs, tea, etc well before ours was even brought out/set up. By that time (when we'd moved to a spot big enough to fit 5 of us) there wasn't properly enough time to finish our hookahs before they closed. And they never quite got it to smoke properly. Until right about 4am when they were strongly encouraging us to leave. Sigh.. still, a good time overall. Not enough late night spots in SF.

FYI - we got the rose mint hookah + green tea - great combo!
author: Ziyan C.

description: The young guy that works there hates white guys. Was so disrespect. Asked to buy something from them and was told to return tomorrow. The guy talked badly about me as I walked away and when I returned to make purchase he said said to return the next day.
author: Jason M.

description: This place has decent hookah, but the service is the worst.  I've come here a few times now, but this past Saturday night there were 3 of us smoking hookah when 2 friends that were in the area stopped in to say hi. The staff immediately freaked out and said 4 or more people need to order a second hookah ($20+).  Like, they would not leave us alone for even a minute just to greet each other.  I explained that my friends were just stopping by, they would be leaving in a few minutes, we would order drinks or tea, and that they don't smoke anyway. To no avail.  Finally we all just got up, paid the check and left so we could hang out in peace.  I won't be back and neither will any of my friends.  It was honestly one of the most ridiculous interactions I've ever had in SF.  To make it worse the owner was sitting at another table and the staff kept pointing to him, egging me on to "go talk to him myself," because if we stayed the owner would get really mad and the staff would get in trouble. WTF?!
author: Sara S.

description: If I wanna talk about flavors all the hookah places in the city they have it but if I wanna talk about super friendly service with an awesome attitude the the only one is here Nile cafe ! I have been in the city for a long time and went to smoke hookah I so many places but since I met Mango the young guy who works at Nile I loved the place and I started to come here at lest once a week , he is super cool and friendly guy that I really enjoy talking to him !!
author: Ghazwan A.

description: A blight on the neighborhood. Noise until 4am regularly from their sidewalk tables screaming at each other for hours. Shut this place down.
author: Jeff B.

description: Very bad hookah and bad service being cheap in the tobacco when we asked them to flex it thy said if you don't like it leave
author: Mohamed M.

description: Relaxed atmosphere, feels very authentic. Kind of a smaller space but lots of chairs. Had a grapefruit flavor and also the house tea (which paired very nicely). The staff was very nice and helpful.
author: Steph D.

description:
Well, I only went here to kill some time before work, but I waited for service and that killed most of the time.
The hookah was mediocre, hardly hinting any flavor, and the pipe was crap with a really cheap plastic cable. And don't get me started with the service. The young man needs to smile, instead of being rude as fuck. And other older guy needs to work instead of stay in the back. Not coming back. Awful service and shit hookah.
author: Joselyn G.

description:
Great tea and hot coco, decent selection of hookah.

The issue is the service.  The coals didn't get turned, it took forever for the hookah, tea, and coco to come out and we barely saw the staff.  It was good enough, though.  Good noise level and upbeat yet chill music.  I could spend time in this one but it was pretty small and didn't feel the cleanest. :) I have been to better but it was good enough for the experience.  I would probably return.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
I have to say that Nile Cafe is probably the best spot in the city to get your hookah / shisha / nargileh on.  It's a cozy little place, but also quite happening on weekend nights and popular with both young middle easterners and others in the know.  

They use good quality tobacco (Starbuzz), are pretty good about coming around to refill coal, and employees/owners are always super nice.  Come for the hookah, but also don't miss out on the Arabic tea.  

Nile Cafe really does make for a fun, chilled out alternative to the bar scene in SF.
author: Joanne G.

description: My cousin and I came to San Fran for a trip and we are middle eastern so we can't go too long without some hookah. We yelped this place and stopped by. Honestly, not the nicest neighborhood, but the lounge was nice, our hookah was well made and they had a nice beverage menu. My only complaint is that there was only one person working the whole place so we had to ask several times for something until we actually got it.
author: Linet O.

description:
Good tea. And may be good hookah, but I would never know. We were 10 people, and most of us just wanted to sit, drink tea and eat stuff, while some of us wanted to smoke Hookah. But the waiter tried to force atleast 1 hokaah per 3 people rule or leave. I would have been more than willing to pay a cover charge, but I am not accepting that rubbish rule.
And when we told him that we prefer leaving after paying for the tea that we already got, the waiter's attitude definitely convinced me to not go there again.
author: Rohit J.

description:
Small with outdoor seating. No alcohol. Went on a Tuesday night. Was disappointed by the service and by the hookah. They were out of mint so I tried the highly recommended (by server) gummy bear flavour. Tasted like rose, which I despise. When I told server that I didn't like it he still charged us for another one, despite having two puffs of it. I think they gave me wrong flavour or an old hose (although they advertise that they use disposable hoses). Ended up with double apple. It took forever for it to "open up," because unlike most hookah spots, they don't get the flavour/smoke going for you. You have to sit there puffing for 10mins before you get a decent smoke, and even then then flavour is minimal at best. 

The service was abysmal which is a part of my hookah experience, note the place wasn't very busy so there was no reason for such poor service. 

I wouldn't recommend this place unless desperate.
author: Adrianne D.

description:
Good place to hangout and relax with a hookah. 
The Obama flavor was light and smooth. Agave was a little rough for me, but I am non-smoker in general.
author: Malathi R.

description:
Pros
- They have Hookah and tea

Cons
- Horrible service
- Pricey
- Sketchy neighborhood
- The place is small

Overall
- There are much better places to go
author: Dipesh G.

description: I had a good time here only because I was with friends but I wouldn't go back if we're going to smoke hookah again. I know they're busy and the house is packed but the guy who's in charge could have treated us better. We ordered three hookahs and two of them were really light that we'd to ask the staffs to fix them.
author: Yanakon D.

description: My first visit hookah place in san francisco was nile cafe. They have very hard working waiter and very sweet. I love how they greet and serve the customers. I love coming here. I really love shamsu, shady, matt, bruno and paula as well ulzhan. Beautiful. I will give them 5
author: Nanita B.

description:
This place has a good ambiance but service could be better.

Suggestions:
-samples to smell
-tongs to move the coal around
-smaller sizes, $20 is a lot for one person to spend on some shisha but makes sense for three people

Good experience overall but it could be a lot better too.

-
author: Ken F.

description:
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. The absolute worst hookah lounge i've ever been to. 

FIRST, the hookahs are all different sizes. At first, we literally thought that this was a "bring your own hookah" kind of place, because there are literally no 2 of the same hookah- they are all different colors and sizes, the latter being the issue. 

So we ask for a nice, tall hookah because at $25 a hookah, I expect more than a 6 inch hookah like many that we saw in there. You can literally BUY your own hookah of that size for $25!!! 
So we ask for a decent hookah, and apparently you can only smoke the tiny ones inside BUT there's a group of 6 guys smoking a gigantic one inside right next to us (what the heck!!!!) and they still refuse to allow us to do this. 

Furthermore, we settle for a medium sized one, and order 2 teas and a Rose/Mint Hookah, then they come and tell us that they are out of Rose, so we ask for Jasmine instead. Then, they tell us they are out of Jasmine too, and that Rose and Jasmine are the same, that if we order Rose or Jasmine, it doesn't matter because they are going to serve us the exact same thing. SERIOUSLY? These people don't even know how to differentiate one flower from another. They are completely different! SOOOO rude and not customer-oriented. 

The tipping point was the table, which my boyfriend ruined his $300 jacket on, because the table was covered in some sticky red stuff that stained his sleeve forever. 

We could not take ANYMORE, and left without another word. 

Oh, and if this review isn't enough to get you not to visit here, there are crazy psychotic people with killer dogs walking around outside. We literally saw a crazy girl walking her gigantic pitbull struggling to keep it from attacking one of the millions of sketchy people walking around outside. STAY AWAY from this place. Not only does this hookah lounge suck, but the neighborhood itself is enough to make one think twice about walking from the car, into the lounge.
author: Paola M.

description: Ghalib "Mango" has been our server every time we come to Nile Cafe and has made our hookah experience just outstanding. He's been on top of it even when it's crowded. The service at this cafe is always above and beyond our expectations. Thanks for making it great!
author: Berké B.

description: Nice intimate environment, cultural and good hookah.
author: Anna B.

description:
It's 2AM and we're stranded in the Tenderloin with alcohol in our veins and nowhere to go. Like a mirage in the tranny filled concrete dessert, Nile Cafe was spotted in the distance. 

We managed to get a table inside next to "cool" Arab teens and their Asian girlfriends pretending to be experts on all that is shisha. It was pretty hilarious. 

All in all it was an OKAY experience. Nothing too special. The seating isn't particularly comfortable and there isn't much space. BUT when you're inebriated it doesn't really matter all that much. 

We ended up paying $30 for one shisha/hookah and three chai teas for four people. We tried the mint guava, which was pretty good.

They DO NOT serve alcohol here so bring your own flask (BYOF).
author: Raha G.

description:
It's a very simple place, the staff was nice.
We took a fruity& mint Hookah, which was tasty, and their tea (obviously).

I would definitely go back, it's nice to chat with friends over a nice hookah.

Don't expect something fancy though, it's a small terrace (3 small tables) and inside there is room for prob 20 people.
author: Alexei C.

description:
Came to smoke hookah with a friend after getting shitty manicures. We tried the Obama flavor, which was described as a fruity/minty flavor. Got a nice nicotine high from it, but I felt as though the hose was clogged, so I didn't get any clean hits. 

Nice experience but huge downside is they were out of ice and couldn't make any of their cold drinks, which is pretty odd for a cafe. Oh well, I'll probably give this place another chance next week and leave an updated review!!
author: Clarissa M.

description:
We got there 4 people at 2:30 am , the place was empty the owner want us to get 2 hookahs per 2 people , we told him that only 2 is smoking and we just want to have a good hookah time . He refuse and say that's the house rule , we all feel like it's a rip off and they only want to over charge you and not give a good service . When my girlfriend explain him that he was yell at her instead to welcome new customers . 
There is better places to HO that respect their clientele 
Don't go there!!! 
Big rip off!!'
author: Ron H.

description: Nice comfort place.  Really friendly and smiley staff. The choice of music is really relaxing.
author: Boris S.

description:
Absolute rubbish. Never come here. Worst service.

the guy tried ripping us off! after getting the receipt , we gave him the cash and receipt. He later on comes running after us saying that we didn't pay him enough and that we were trying to not pay the bill.
author: Abhi M.

description:
Contrary to what the business might say, they do NOT accept credit cards. They will always use the line, with customers, "our machine is broken..." So that part on yelp, at the moment, is incorrect. 

They were unattentive and we had to go up to the cashier and let then know we had to leave. 

Never moved our coals around until I blatantly mentioned, in front of the manager, that our shisha was harsh. He flicks the coal with his finger and that's about it. 

It was my 2nd time here, because I always believe you should try things at least 2 times, but I think that will be my last time here.
author: Alexander M.

description:
This is an update from my first review in 2009. This place took a NOSE DIVE since then. 
I consider myself a connoisseur of the mighty Shisha, and the last time I went to the Nile after being out of the country, I was so disappointed. Something happened to this place, it used to be such a gem.
To prove it wasn't just me, I'll list what changed:

-No more lounging couches inside, just hard tables
-No more wood coal in a brazier outside: now they use that coconut stuff that over-burns. That would be fine, if they gave you tongs to shuffle it around yourself, but they don't, so your shisha just burns black.
-No more starbuzz. Not sure what it is now, but it's not starbuzz you're smoking,
-No more prompt service to help, which sucks, since you don't have tongs.
-Prices went up to match the competition (possibly exceed).

Basically, this hookah is what you make at home, nothing impressive at all anymore. For some reason buttloads of Middle Eastern looking kids still like to come here in big groups. If you're with them, I guess this place is the sh*t. But I'm pretty sure their moms hang out at Pride...so I'm probably going to start going back there.

I'm leaving one star for the super nice Russian (?) sounding waitress and yummy coffee blends and mint tea.

Otherwise, skip it. I hate how hard it is to get a decent hookah in this city. F*cking hippies harshing my mellow.
author: Diana H.

description: Hookahs taste great, came all the way from Sacramento and was a little hesitant on coming here due to some previous bad reviews I'm really happy I overlooked that and came. Service is not bad, a little language barrier but if you take your time and explain what you want you'll do just fine. Hookah lasted 2 & 1/2 hours without loosing flavor or taste! Definitely would come back and recommend to anyone looking for a late night place to smoke some amazing hookah. Place is small but what isn't in the city. Perfect for 2 or 4 people. Don't let those few bad reviews discourage you. Check this place out!
author: Mo T.

description: Mango provides 5 star service!!! He is the best and makes best hookah and house tea!!! Really good person to deal with!!!!! Ask for Mango!!!!!
author: Max Y.

description: Went 2 times the first time the hookah was okay the second time it was not the best, but i will give it another shot
author: Ghenwa S.

description: Nice hole in the wall. Friendly staff. Fair service. A little overpriced. Only like 10 flavor options though and were out of half them. I'm more of a fruit flavors person but all they had was mints. Also very cheap hoses.
author: Ivan E.

description: I have been away from home - (LA) for about 5 weeks and the Nile Hookah Cafe was my favorite place to be after a long day at work. I enjoyed each day I was there- the hookah was the best- specially the house special tea and Obama Hookah. lm3allem
author: ari A.

description: Took 20 minutes for service. Asked for guava and double apple. They gave us mint instead of guava, didn't even let us know they ran out. Tried to order some drinks, they said they weren't able to make anything. They only had the house tea, which they never gave us. The mint was pretty smooth, not very flavorful. I really liked the double apple, but it started to get very harsh after a few puffs. Terrible service, I won't be back.
author: Sandy W.

description:
This place has a homey feel from when you walk in. With dim lights and comfy seating a comfortable and inviting atmosphere is created. We seated ourselves and we were attended to within minutes of seating. We ordered a guava flavored shisha for our hookah that was flavorful and sweet. It had a pronounced guava taste that was quite surprising and he came to change our coal roughly after 45 min. Since I was with my friend, I was hoping we'd be given a 2 hose hookah, but we were just given a one hose with 2 mouth tips. We have no issue sharing a hose, but I feel for others it may be inconvenient to change mouth tips every time the hose is passed. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the place and will likely come again. 
We were charged $20 so we split $10 each which was very reasonable since we were there for almost 2 hours.
author: Veronica L.

description:
I'd only go back to this place if Michael Jackson came back from the dead, told me that I'm just ignorant and this place serves hookah in a 18kgold bong that you get to keep afterwards.

Nobody acknowledged us when we entered the lounge so we just stood there like idiots wondering if we could sit outside since it was a nice night. We got tired of standing around so we sat down at an empty table while one of the guys went to confirm with the waiter that it was okay for us to sit there. CONFIRMED.

If you enjoy waiting around for 45mins to place (yes, you read correctly), just to even PLACE your order, this is the place for you.

Our waiter didn't even know what flavors they even offered -- We asked for the strawberry watermelon mix and he told us that they didn't have strawberry. Then as he's reading back our order he asks us if we want the strawberry flavor. Thought you said you didn't have that flavor, buddy.  Wait, you do have it? You don't have watermelon. Actually, no scratch that, you don't have strawberry. 

We went with the rose. He comes back 30 mins later and tells us they don't have the rose either.  It takes 30 mins for you to figure out that you don't have rose? Didn't come back with the tea and 3 bottles of water we ordered either. 

We ended up waiting around for an hour and 45 mins before we decided to leave. Why didn't we get up at the 30 min mark? We were curious to see just how awful this place could be. And man, it is really just the most awful place I've ever been to. 

The employees seemed more interested in saying hello to their friends and seating those they know. Is this a business or is this some kind of friends and family gathering establishment? I guess it's more important to fist pound and one arm hug your homies who get served with 2 hookahs before us even though we sat down a good 20 mins before them.

I don't understand how this place has 4 stars.  Are SF's hookah standards just really low? If so, I need to go back to the east coast and take SFers with me.
author: Cindy K.

description:
The first time I came here was great. Each time I come here afterwards has become worst. The place gets busy for such a small place. 

They get the hookahs to the people very quickly, but are slow in filling it with charcoal. Another thing slow about them is the drinks, ordered our drinks and they came half an hour later. Did I mention they were the wrong ones too. 

They did a little remodeling recently; putting in a bench where a few chairs were before. Part of that remodel was replacing the door on the restroom, they just forgot to put a lock there. So there are no locks for the restroom.

And the guys who work here often just stand outside and socialize with their friends. Friends who often just have their car double parked in front of the place because parking is so hard.
author: M C.

description: Love this spot especially the sweet lady working behind the counter but the saudi arabian guy is an ass very disrespectful and a smart mouth you need to fire him
author: Eman Z.

description: The mya hookah is really cool and small. It blows clouds like crazy!!
author: Nolim N.

description: Nice place to smoke shisha and the turkish coffee was great and employee was nice yok but the place is a little small.
author: İsmail Cem E.

description: New ownership? Things are suddenly different and not for the better at Nile Cafe. I'm very surprised their yelp rating is as high as it is and honestly question if some of the positive reviews were written by employees of the establishment. The service was poor and their bouncer was rude. On top of that, their selection of flavors were extremely limited and the flavors they did have were mediocre, at best. There are so many other hookah bars in SF that I would recommend over this establishment. The Nile Cafe I once knew is dead.
author: Robert B.

description: Terrible place!!! The lounge itself was cramped and poorly lit, the hookahs were in questionable condition, and the hookah flavoring was marginal - which I think the owner recommended. This would all be forgivable if it was somewhat cheap or if there was good service but I think you'll find those elements lacking as well ($20 a hookah?? GET REAL). Do yourself a favor and patronize one of SF's many other lounges, you'll be happy you did.
author: James M.

description: Awesome place to just chill out and pass the time on a Friday night. The place is really tight though in the literal sense especially if you're seated on the side since the tables are cramped together. It's $20 for the hookah and it comes with 3 coals which lasted me and my friend a good 3 hours. About 20 flavors to choose from (we chose the Obama), and the smoke is smooth even till the end. If you come here, just make sure to come here with a friend since there has to be at least two to three customers per hookah set and they also provide hose pieces for each guest for sanitary purposes. Great service and atmosphere as well. Will definitely visit again next time i'm back in town.
author: Arvin D.

description: I've been to Nile Cafe almost consistently in the weekdays for a little over two months now. The spatial wise is honestly quite confined and I would not recommend large group gatherings in such a place; ideally 2-4 people. I've only ever really popped in before sundown and Mango (the person who usually manages the place when I am there) has been of excellent service thus far. He familiarizes himself with his customers very quickly and delivers what his regulars want almost promptly shortly after arrival. The place works very well for me, i often travel with my work so the coffee table setting was a bonus when I discovered the place. There's a limited palette for hookah, or shisha, flavors and the taste usually runs after about an hour, so I wouldn't fret about getting more charcoals unless you favour some sort of a burnt flavour; it's also a good sign to let your lungs breathe some fresh air.
author: Mabel T.

description: This placed sucked I love hookah and I came here and got 2 hookah cut the limit is 3 a hooka and we had 4 I had no Idea this place was low tech the space small 20 bucks a hookah come on this guy recommend a flavor so I took it said no one complains it's great yeah they do but you don't do anything the flavor was horrible I told him it sucks everyone here hates it but no he said you probably don't know it's hookah or something  um not my first time they use napkins as gaskets to hold the hoses in wow come on you need use something better horrible Un satisfying
author: Jonathan R.

description: The waiter told us to get the fuck out because we wanted to cancel the tea which took over a half hour to make. So rude. He should get fired
author: Reem A.

description: After much disappointment of the area, atmosphere and selection of tobacco. I receive my hot tea and the server spills it on my leg. No apology and no means of rectifying the situation I had a mediocre hookah and which in la wouldn't cut in for a minute. Ewwwww
author: anna j.

description:
Really? charge for charcoal? First place in the world that I've seen that. And no Visa, and their debit machine doesn't work, so if you only have $19 in cash, they'll threaten to call the police. Slow service as well.

Worst I've seen.
author: K A.

description:
This place was a lot of fun!  I don't usually do much in the way of tobacco, but I was convinced to come hookah after a few drinks earlier in the night.  Inside was too full to fit our group (they seem to be pretty packed most of the weekend nights) but there were a few tables outside for us to sit at that were a bit cold, but otherwise fine.  

Service wasn't as good outside as I could've hoped, but the servers came by whenever we asked for refills of coals, tea, and even gave us a hookah at half off because we'd made a mistake and ordered the wrong flavor.

Overall a pretty fun place to come chill and hookah with a few friends.
author: Keith C.

description: I wouldn't suggest that you go here. The people working seemed to be more confused than a fish in the forest. The pipe was pretty bad and the coals were a low grade coconut shell coal. The place is tiny and the seating is ridiculous. There are small hookahs that are at a large bar area in the middle but they clearly don't change the water and admitted this to us when we asked. We would be ignored for far to long and would have to travel inside to remind them that we need new coals multiple times before actually getting any. All in all if you are in the area I suggest you just stay away from this place.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Went here for hookah with a bunch of people from work. Great place to chill and sit outside. We had the rose hookah which had a great flavor to it. 

Their card machine doesnt work so make sure you carry cash. 

If you sit outside , be prepared to be greeted by the homeless guy walking by. We had the same guy come and ask us for money 5 times in an hour. 

Hookah is reasonably priced and would surely recommend this place.
author: Priyanka P.

description: I so hate that place! it's so expensive, owner is so rude and the most important thing is they fool you with tobacco stones that has flavors and they only put a lil bit of a real flavor ! Also, i don't recommend anyone to get hot drinks from there. It's so unclean.
author: Bela M.

description: The venue is super small and narrow. We were told that they only had about 5 flavors out of their 10-15 they advertise on their menu. We had to ask 4 times for our water and they had to fix our hookah twice to get the smoke going. Overall, the service is really bad, the hookah apparatus seems cheap and wasn't the best atmosphere.
author: Sarai Q.

description:
This place is ok for what it is; it's one of the only hookah places in the neighborhood let alone a place that actually serves its own tea, it's a small place, and there's barely any parking around. The reason why I gave this place 3/5 stars is mainly because I almost felt discriminated against by one of the servers of this hookah lounge. 

My friends and I asked this one particular server over and over again for water and new coals but after every time we asked, he either 1) went back to the kitchen and would never come back 2) when he did come out with coals he only went to the people outside and people sitting on the pillow area who didn't even wave him down beforehand or 3) or walk by and completely ignore us. 

I know for a fact that my friends and I were not being rude either; we always said please and thank you and never told him to hurry up or anything. I actually timed him in one instance to see how long it would take him to come back with coals (from the point we asked and the point to where we actually got coals) 24 minutes and 17 seconds. How does it take that long to fire a thing of coals and put them in that little silver pan? The place isn't that big either; it has 3 booths, a few small tables on the side, one large pillow area, and one table outside.

I don't know, bottom line is that he gave very poor customer service.
The House Tea is as good as everyone says, but I'd rather have good hookah and better service than good tea, sorry.
author: Greg H.

description: Horrible place. The service was so slow. The workers were rude and all extremely drunk. I asked the same guy like four times to bring us new coals and he kept forgetting. We finally asked another employee ( he had coals and was distributing them to others) so he finally stopped and gave us some. The hookah wasn't that great and it was pretty Damn pricy ( 23$) per hookah when I usually go to places who have it at ~$10. Place is incredibly small and you barely have any room to enjoy your hookah . Will not be coming again.
author: Giselle V.

description:
Place is worth to visit if you're too lazy to find 724 :) anyway, shisha was great and the guy who made it was helpful and friendly. 
This bar is too small to relax.
author: Nikolay S.

description: Good spot in the Tenderloin after a good meal next door at Shalimar. Comfy pillows in the front window seat if you can snag it. The bathroom door does not lock, so it's a precarious wait. They're pretty good at replenishing your coals and taking your order. Good friends=good times
author: Naomi K.

description:
$20 for a hookah is a tad steep... but the flavor was choose was good.

Theo, Chuck and I split a their Nile flavor, which was a mix of a ton of awesome. It was floral, minty, fresh, clean, almost like smoking a plethora of sweet alcoholic drinks and perfumes, which sounds kind of weird, but thats the only way I can explain the randomness from the tobacco pack. It was seriously really good and smooth.

Also, they do pack the tobacco in densely, and the coals are ultra slow burners and hold shape, instead of ash out easy and crumble into the pot. This prevents you from getting a really harsh burn.

But at 20, I think its a bit more than I'd pay for. Then again, I have friends who have hookahs, so maybe thats why the price turns me off just a bit.
author: Marc T.

description: Nice place to piece together the night. The tea is so relaxing accompanied by friendly service.
author: Eve C.

description:
Alright, so I guess these guys added a new edition to their lounge and they now have an outdoor patio section right in front with a few tables and a bunch of chairs. It's pretty awesome, if you are properly dressed for a San Francisco winter night. I.E. it gets really really cold, but it's nice to have fresh air (as fresh as you can get in the city) and not be crammed into their little lounge inside. Anyways, I'll make my review easy.

1. Unless you get there early, expect a full/packed little cafe that can/will be noisy.

2. If there on said packed night, EXPECT A WAIT! They are understaffed, over-populated, and have a huge demand! 

3. They guys working there however are nice, and doing their best.

4. Really nice selection and variety of Hookah for a reasonable price.

5. Excellent house tea! Order it! 

6. Excellent Armenian coffee! Get some! 

7. Sitting outside = the best people watching entertainment ever & maybe some new friends!  (or annoying drunktards who talk too loud and you hope to leave soon)


last thing... and the reason you do not get 5 stars

8. The bathroom. This is the most disgusting bathroom. For fucks sake, can't you guys get a freaking toilet seat THAT ACTUALLY STAYS ATTACHED and maybe DO A LITTLE UPKEEP THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT!!!!?????!!!!!!!!! 
-If you expect to pee at all through your hookah experience, maybe just don't.
author: Bee S.

description:
the worst customer service i ever seen. i always come sunday but last time i come with my friends on Tuesday     27,may 2014 the guy who was working there is really stu****d it took him 15 minute to give me the hookha .... 
with really light Measel....
he didnt want to add charcoal  i dont now why? 
its really interesting  I  asked him like 6 times but he didnt add the charcoal 
    and he charged me $25 for hookha only not new hose. 
i have to stap back fom this st***d guy who work on tuesday
author: Davied M.

description: Best hooka ever! Ignor thoes who tarnish the place. You have to go and discover the differnt flovers of hookas this place has to offer. I would recommend obama and nile mix.
author: ahmed a.

description:
Nice place and atmosphere, but the service was a lackluster.

The way they price seemed ridiculous to me, but i may just be used to LA prices.

I'm sure the tea would have been better if we didn't get it just above luke-warm, and the hookah coal was never offered to be changed.  

The bathrooms were in need of cleaning when we were there.

I'd pass on this one.
author: Daniel K.

description: Really slow service. took 30 minutes to get the water we ordered because the waiter forgot, same with out bill. hookah was decent, wait was unacceptable.
author: Dan H.

description: This is a first for me! I am actually sitting in the place and that is how mad I am, writing this right away! " the owner is not here!" This is a sentence that was mentioned to us by all the employees here whenever we ask for something! The hookah we got was burnt the moment it came, we asked to change it but they are like we will charge you for a new head coz the owner is not here!! Ok!! So he asked you to treat costumers like this!! I am not coming back to this place again!! It used to be really good! Not anymore, better not come!! I wish i can give less than one review!
author: Dalia Q.

description: House tea. It'll leave you feening. Don't miss it.
author: Mansi A.

description:
They make really good hookah. And their house tea is amazing. The place is small and gets packed easily but the environment is nice. I like the arabic music being played in the background. 

It will be great if they start accepting credit cards. It is cash only
author: Hani A.

description: I came to this cafe last night . Their serves was too bad . If you like to have good time with your friends do not come here. There is no option to give them 0 star .
author: Mohammed R.

description: My boyfriend and I were looking for a hookah place in SF and this was the nearest place. It was too crowded to sit inside so we decided to sit outside. It was super cold (no heat lamps) but the hookah was decent. It's also in a bad area so be aware of your surroundings and belongings!
author: Kat P.

description:
This place has so much potential, but the staff manage to mess it up by being lazy. 
They use 'natural' coconut coals and have a decent selection of hookah flavors. The atmosphere is also pretty laid back.

The problem:

Customer service. They don't have any. I've been in a few times, and each time, I've had to wait for far too long for my hookah. Even when it is not busy. The last time we waited for almost almost an hour, before we finally decided to cut our losses and just left. As we finally left, the owner had the audacity to ask why were leaving after having ordered.

The hookah: Its hit or miss. Sometimes its very good, sometimes its very bad (depending on who makes it). The problem is, when they get it wrong (i.e. pack the tobacco incorrectly, too much/little water), they will go to any lengths not to change it. 

A real shame, as they have a lot of potential.
author: Fooda H.

description: Good service. The hookah flavors are really good. The neighborhood can be a bit intimidating to some because of the homeless people, but they're harmless. I sat outside a few times with people asking my company and I for money, but the waiters inside will literally stand in front of you and ask the person to go about. The last time I visited they let my friends and I try some of the and it was amazing.
author: Rochelle R.

description: I've been here twice and they are always out of something! Kind of ridiculous. Otherwise, their prices for a hookah is pretty good. It's only $20, but that's only for up to 3 people. This place is pretty small and has just one bathroom with no lock.
author: Vanessa S.

description: This is one of the few hooka places left around SF. They have a good hooka flavor selection and they refill the coals several times. The tea is the best! Don't let the neighborhood fool you. There may be some homeless people outside asking you for money, but they are harmless. It also seems like they remodeled the place, so they don't have the pillows on the floor anymore. Did I mention the tea is delicious?!
author: Nadia M.

description:
$20 per hookah, three people per hookah. If you have four they make you drop another $20 on another hookah. THAT BECOMES $10+ PER PERSON.

I just wanted to make that clear because this place is a rip-off. I came here three times and have vowed never to go back. It is only enjoyable if you come during one of their slow times, otherwise it is cramped and loud. As many other reviews have said, awful service.

Only positive things I can say: Arabic tea is to die for. I've yet to find/make another as addicting as their recipe. The place has an authentic and unique Arabic vibe.
author: Mary M.

description: Very unprofessional and unaccommodating. Will not even serve you any tea if you don't plan on smoking hookah. I've been coming here for over 3 years and for the first time today, I decided to not have hookah and just ask for the adini tea. They refused and asked me to leave. How rude. Very disappointed.
author: James H.

description:
This little hole-in-the-wall is easy to miss. We dipped in here for a hookah after a lovely dinner date and had a great time. It's a really unassuming place. The furniture is threadbare, and the decor isn't really inspired - it's kind of thrown together - but I liked that. It didn't seem pretentious at all. There were two other tables there during our visit and everyone seemed relaxed and comfortable.

For $20, we had an hour-long, flavourful cardamom hookah. The clerk topped us up with fresh coals regularly. He wasn't very talkative at all and didn't attend to us except with coals, but I didn't mind - I wasn't there to hang out with him. We also had a pot of sweet Arabic tea which complemented our hookah perfectly.

We'll certainly go back, if only because it's a cheap and delightful way to spend time with friends. Something about hookah inspires deep, honest conversation.
author: Malloreigh M.

description:
We had a 45 minute wait...he called us, as we were waiting two blocks away at the Hilton (killing time and stayin' out of the cold).  We ran and got a table...woohoo!!

Tea = totally yummy.  I love the house tea.  I had three individual pots of it...heh...

Hookah = awesome.  Lots of flavors.  We loved the Nile Mix #2...guava and blueberries...omnomnom.  

Service = okay.  Friendly but they're busy.

Decor = cozy. Lots of arab music and music videos, w00t!
Size of place = super tiny.  Bathroom = total traffic jam area.  lol 

Prices = decent. One flavor, one hookah, up to 3 people and 3 coals = $15-20/total.  So....we had two hookahs, some tea, and it was $42.00.  Not too shabby for six people.

Pictures of 'purple' smoke (via camera phone) = priceless.

But yeah...get over here, if you have the time to wait.  Although...my only dislike for this place, is actually to do with some of the clientele...drunk mofos and assfaces.  Rude to the staff. :-(

This ain't exactly a very 'cool' area, so...you've been warned. :)
author: Fannie S.

description:
THE. TEA. 

That's all I have to say. It's amazing. The location is majorly sketchy; the location of Shalimar and Dottie's makes it a pretty active street. 

I'm not a hookah expert but I can appreciate a place that has reasonable prices, a causal atmosphere, AMAZING TEA and lets your sit back and enjoy the evening clouded in smoke. 

Sadly a group of friends went again last night and I couldn't attend BUT I will be back to enjoy with another set of friends.
author: Jade W.

description:
We were not quite sure why everyone was ragging on this place. So we went to check it out.  Except for the price, it is a top shelf bar.  We took out bar-tender,  Teddy's advice and tried the Nile Blend which was very pleasant.  We have tried other bar's and this one rates right up there.  Good music, comfortable surroundings and great service.  
Bring some friends with you because the neighborhood is super sketchy.
author: Keith D.

description:
This place is super awesome. Late night, midweek it is less crowded and the staff are able to serve better (and be social). The guys who work here are awesome and the hookah flavours - of the few that I have tried - have been great. 

The best combo is sitting outside on a warmer night by the heater, hookah in hand and sipping on some masala tea with a handful of evening conversation.
author: Dilip R.

description: Really nice atmosphere and great cold beer,  no hookah anymore though,  SF cracked down on a lot of hookah places and this one didn't make it through. If looking for a nice bar with good beer though,  I definitely recommend it.
author: Wilbert S.

description:
I.  LOVE.  NILE.  CAFE.  I've been here so many times with friends and it's quite possibly my favorite spot in the San Francisco.

The place is small, but it's cozy...and if you like the people you come here with, then you probably won't mind sitting next to them.  

Still can't figure out what's in the tea... My educated guess is cardamum, white sugar, honey and traces of crack (because WTF it's so addictive).

*Secret Menu Item* - ask for the "Obama" Mix... it won't jumpstart the economy, but it will definitely give you a good buzz .

The owner also is very friendly and you can tell he's a good business man.  He always says hello to the regulars and makes sure we're all at home.

My only complaint about Nile Cafe - not enough staff.  There is usually one guy working there and poor thing, he is SO overworked!  Despite that, he is always very polite and never gets frustrated.

Oh, I guess my other complaint is that the music is too loud sometimes...

Ok, that's all.  I'm not removing any stars for my complaints - this place is totally worth it for the hookah and tea :).

OH, I have one suggestion - they should have a "Frequent Hookah-ers" card or something...for as much as I go, it would be nice to get a free session every 15th or 20th time :).

OKBYE!
author: Natasha S.

description: It was an actually cute little spot, its just ... the feng shui of it (so I think) is a little off. The tables are by the wall, there's one huge one in the middle and its a tiny little place. The service was great and tea was absolutely wonderful! It's just ... I had anxiety just even walking in, I'm used to being around tight big crowds... but having the tables spread out they way they were and having to be seated next to a wall... with no other space to move, was difficult. On another note, I didn't like that they played Hip Hop because all the ratchets came out and got crazy. If they just had made some adjustments, this place would be better 8) Just my two cents!
author: Marevie T.

description:
Well, the place is tinyyy. The only really cool thing about it is a corner with pillows for everyone to sit in.

There was 4 of us, and the guy made us get 2 hookahs (1 hookah/3people and he couldnt make an exception for us..)

And, it wouldn't have hurt him to crack a smile here and there, considering we were probably his better customers of the night.

2 stars for our great chai tea lattes.
author: Irina Z.

description:
After having an awkward experience at Shalimar, my friends and I stopped in here to smoke a little. It was a Monday night, so it wasn't the most bumping place, but there was a big group on the floor, smoking while using the wifi and a few other people looking busy. We sat down in super comfortable chairs, and tried the lemon mint, as well as a bit of tea.

The lemon mint was really refreshing. I'm usually not a fan of fruit flavors, but the combination was a perfect balance of the two flavors, and it left a very clean feeling in my mouth. They also had individual mouthpieces for each person, which impressed me, but I haven't smoked at a shisha bar in the United States, so I don't know if that's just par for the course. 

The TV was tuned to Melody Arabia which provided quite a bit of entertainment for me and my friends, and led to a discussion on what kind of women middle-eastern men find attractive. (By watching Melody Arabia, one would believe that all women in the middle east are incredibly skinny and act like 12 year-olds, but I suppose someone can make that same commentary on MTV). 

The ambiance was great, and they had an extensive selection of flavors. While I'm not itching to try their guava lemon mint combination (I detest guavas), there were several others that I would definitely come back to try. Four stars.
author: Angeline P.

description:
Nile's Cafe is the place to be for excellent quality hookah, tea, friendly service, and most of all a relaxing and enjoyable time with good social company. I've become a regular every other weekend, as I have scoped other outlets of Hookah in the city but none exceeded the same quality standards as Niles. As I became more acquainted to the place, I befriended the owner. An upbeat awesome guy who truly caters to his customers' needs and taste. The best seat is by the front window on carpet floors and soft satin pillows. Whenever, I'm feeling down or stressed from work or school, Niles is my go to for instant and lasting relief through out the day. It doesn't matter whether I'm going with a single friend or a group, everytime has always been a pleasant experience at Niles with it's contemporary/chill music on or the happy go lucky waiters standing by. Niles lives up to its 5 star quota!

**2009 edit: " I tasted Obama ;) "
author: Fat C.

description:
The tea at Nile Cafe is truly extraordinary. It's not super cheap, but with 3 friends, we shared pot after pot of this magical concoction. It's sweet and delicious... really the best tea I have EVER had! 

The hookah is also very good and everyone at the cafe (visitors and staff) are very friendly. They were quick to re-load our coals when they started to burn down... many awesome flavor options too from coconut to other fruits to just about anything you can imagine... 

The hookah bar is medium-sized, cozy, and very comfortable. At one of the tables, you get to sit on the floor but most are more regular tables. 

Nile Cafe is a great spot to relax over many pots of tea and maybe some hookah too!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Time stands still.

In this tiny little place, you feel like you've been transported to an Arabian cafe and that you're miles and miles away from America.  The hookah lasted us ages (over an hr and a half) - had the double apple which was good.

The dont serve alcohol so we tried the house tea which is highly recommended.

I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a nice chill spot to smoke some hookah and have a conversation.  Watch out, you'll look at your watch and realize its far later than you thought it was.... you've been warned! :)

Enjoy it!  I know I'll be back.
author: Julie B.

description:
The Nile Cafe & Hookah Lounge is the place to be if you are in the mood for some hookah, tea, or chai tea latte. They have great flavors; my favorite is the Mint. 

The ambiance is also  great due to the decor and the music they play.
author: Shayan A.

description: I was there siting outside having hookah. Very pleasant the Staff works very hard. Good tea and the hookah was ok. I was very annoyed that the owner was sitting in his car out in front of the place double parked the entire time I was there. That  was the big turn off
author: Eugene K.

description: One of the first hookah lounge that my friend introduced me to when we went on our date. I didn't really like the song choices, because I didn't understand what they were saying but that didn't bother me. Service isn't the best here either, I would say sometimes it would take a lot to get their attention. I tried their house tea and I would say with the hookah and house tea together that really helps hit it off. This place is relaxing and chill, and is a good place to do hookah and just talk about life or whatever. My favorite flavor here was the guava, and this place isn't too spacious therefore I would recommend checking out other hookah places if your going in a big group. Overall, the price was not too appealing to me, but  if your just with a few friends and its convenient then feel free to check this place out because they're alright just not the best.
author: Katherine N.

description: Hookah lounges are great for groups. For this small and tight space doesn't do good for me and my friends. However, the flavors were awesome. I recommend the mint and watermelon :)
author: Stephanie S.

description:
This place can get crowded but if you're looking for hookah and tea in the middle of the night and don't mind TL then it's a great place.  The people working there are so friendly given how busy it gets.  

It's a small place so there's a lot of bumping around but it's nice, cozy, and the hookah is stronger than other places I've been to in the city.

Did I mention the tea?  It's so awesome!  When I get old and need an IV put in me for fluids I want that tea running through my veins.
author: Vicky C.

description: by far the worst hookah experience I've had to date. To say the service was awful is an understatement. We had to wait a full hour to get coals - and this was after we waited 20 minutes to be seated and another half hour for an unlit hookah. I'm not from SF, but I'm sure there are wayyy better hookah places to spend your money.
author: Naureen H.

description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Absolutely horrible. I have never experienced a server having that much disrespect for their customers. Everything from yelling at us to threatening to kick us out to mean mugging. I just wouldn't recommend such terrible service for anyone. Id rather NOT smoke hookah than have to come here. JUST DON'T DO IT.
author: Jyoti K.

description:
My favorite hookah spot in SF. Wide selection of shisha including some hits like Apple-Cinnamon and Lemon-Mint. Nile offers nice sidewalk seating with a ringside seat to the daily tenderloin churn. Unfortunately they're not open on weekday afternoons, but they make a great evening destination.

Their clientelle, location, and tobacco selection beat Marakesh, Kan-Zaman, and Pride of the Med. hands down, no question.

One star deducted for not having Lebanese Cedar shisha and for pawning off a weak-drawing pipe on me.

[ To the reviewer below who made the racism accusation: I don't believe you. ]
author: John M.

description:
Love, love, love, I am definitely impressed! My friends and I came here last weekend after a terrible hour and a half of waiting in line for a club with no success. Having paid the ridiculous fare for parking (as is customary for San Francisco), we were pretty bummed that we didn't get in. Lucky for us, we had a backup plan! We walked the two blocks down to Nile Cafe, and we almost missed it because it just looked like a tiny little coffee shop. It's definitely a small space, but the atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable. They have music videos that play on the TV in the corner, but it's not so loud that you find yourself shouting over it to talk. We were seated in the corner on a floor mat with plush pillows and we weren't allowed to wear our shoes on it. We were so grateful to finally take our heels off and relax, because standing in line is the least fun way to spend a Saturday night.

We ordered the Nile Mix, which they wouldn't tell us what it was comprised of. This was fine - I'm all for a little mystery! The flavor was smooth and delicious and oh-so-easy to smoke. The service was good, although nothing to rave about. They came by and replaced our coals often enough, and brought out our drinks in a timely manner.

If I'm ever back in San Francisco and find myself not wanting to stand in line again, this is definitely going to be my backup place!
author: April B.

description: This is not a nice block.  But the way this manager here keeps his customers safe.  It is a great oasis and hangout.
author: pilou o.

description:
My first Hookah experience.  It was a great time...very relaxing.  This place is small and the seating wasn't the most comfortable.  However the service was great and the Hookah was enjoyable.  The highlight however was the house tea.  That was amazing.

Last tip...don't do Hookah before a long run the next day.  My lungs were screaming "you are a dumb-ass" the next day.
author: Brandon M.

description:
It may be small, but it is one of my favorite places to smoke hookah and snag delicious tea. I love that this place doesn't cater to teeny bopper 18 year-olds, playing top forty and whatever lame hip-hop is in at the moment. The music they play helps set the mood. I wouldn't mind even more traditional music, though. I also love the floor seating by the window. Whenever I have a larger party or the place is a little more empty, they'll let us sit there. It's the perfect excuse for taking off your shoes :)

The only thing I don't really like is the 3 person limit on a hookah. I wish they would bump it up to four, because 2 hookahs for for people is sometimes too much for me =/
author: Magda L.

description: I haven't been to a lot of hookah bars in the bay area, but I had a great time here. The service was certainly a little slow and inattentive, but overall a really enjoyable evening. The server recommended the house tea which was a sweet hot tea and it was magnificent. The Citrus Mint hookah was perfect and delicious.
author: Benjamin K.

description: The hookah was good, but the tables were a little flimsy. They shake almost every time you go to hit the hookah (at least ours was).  The service was a bit slow. I really enjoyed the music. It's a nice place to just eat and hookah with some friends. I would go back there again.
author: Haley W.

description: Nice place where you can get best tea. Awesome Flavor! It has good flavors for hookah too !!!
author: Review G.

description:
This place is definitely awesome. The people there are really friendly, and you can usually chat it up with anyone. They have a wide variety of shisha to choose from. The house tea is amazing! I love the variety of music that plays. It gets really crrrrrazy late at night- in a good way! Definitely worth a visit.

EDIT: I knocked off a star because of the management. I'm not going to say any more...
author: Aryn B.

description:
This is a very small, hole-in-the-wall place.  We had a group of 7-8 that kept whittling down until 4 am (it's open THAT late on Friday/Saturdays).  We sat in a booth on the floor with lots of colorful & comfy cushions.  There's great Arabic/Turkish music playing, and music videos.    

The hookah was really good, we got two flavors and they were both strong (one fruity, one floral).  The coals were refilled regularly.

Great place to hang out late at night with your close friends.  Personally, I like Morac in the Mission better (it's significantly more upscale, but correspondingly expensive - more of a date place).
author: Bee M.

description:
After having some great indian food across the street. My BFF and i decided to go hookah since it was a Monday night we were the only ones in the Lounge.
 It was awesome, we got the mango flavor. Let me tell you it was every penny worth it, it lasted it us like an hour and a half! The taste was looong lasting. It was a shame we didn't pick one of the EXOTIC FLAVORS but i will for sure be back for the sex in the beach.

I would give this place 5 star but the asian guy that works there wasn't too friendly or helpful and they kept looking at us weird( but again we were the only ones there). Also they don't serve alcoholic drinks.
author: Julia D.

description: Bullshit place .. I came here at 2:30am on Friday and they told me they don't serve hookah after 2am but on yelp it said they r open until 4am ...  I asked the manger and he said they only serve hookah until 2am but the people who are already smoking have until 4am to leave and then I saw the anger give his friends hookah.. .. It's shitty place and no place to sit.. I would never recommend it.
author: Akash S.

description:
This place is amazing, hands down. Sure, it's cramped, but the service is great. The people working here are hella friendly, and their tea is to DIE for! Every time I come here, whether it be with one friend or more, I always make sure to order a large pot of tea firsthand.

Some of my favorite flavors are:
Double Apple
Pineapple Crush
