Irish Cream (tastes kinda' like chocolate, but in a not-so-awkward way)
Pomegranate and White Grape

Not only do they have great hookah and tea, but they have interesting music, and their music videos are extremely interesting to watch, if you like Indian music.

I seriously wish I could rate this place even more stars, that's how much I love this place!!!
author: Isaac D.

description: I like this place in general. Service is a little slow. Note that they no longer takes cards and the cost of hookah is now $20. That price has gone up a LOT.
author: M-C R.

description:
Cute little spot!! IF you're claustrophobic, DO NOT go here though. It's very small and always PACKED. You'll probably  be rubbing thighs with your neighbor so get to know them or find another place to go. They have a little area towards the front you may enjoy if you have a bigger group. They also have outdoor seating with heat lamps if you're ok with the occasional bum asking you for money. Nile cafe has a great variety of flavors and the service is very friendly. Along with our hookah the boyfriend and I tried their arabic tea which was super strong, or maybe it was just super sweet. Either way small tea pot and the tea cups were enough. That's all that would be needed to keep you up or on a sugar high for days. 

If you're in the area looking for a night of fun with no alcohol~ I'd recommend this place. It's a great time.
author: Rie P.

description:
I feel bad, my friend and I came here to burn off some steam and obviously I found this cute little place on our beloved yelp.  We thought, hey this is going to be pretty chill, I guess.
...Yeah.. it was chill...sooo chilly, they left the door open and it's fucking like... 25 degrees outside with wind, gosh!

Well we got pineapple crush (tasty, yes) but they gave us a hookah that just totally fell apart quickly, and when we inhale, air leaks out from the pipe connection thing, so we have to hold on to the fuckin thing like you're holding a _____  ...
*SIDENOTE* NOT FROM EXPERIENCE

so yeah.. We only came here for literally like 10 minutes and were a bit disappointed, not many people were there and the atmosphere doesn't make you feel all dancey inside or anything (like Cairo Nights does) so we just bounced.

Felt soo bad because the cashier looked at us with puppy eyes and asked how their hookah was. Yah it was good!! But uh... We're about to hit the clubs now (more like switch to Cairo Nights)

Ohhhh okay, hehe I see.

Awww!!! I feel so bad!  The people are soo nice but we fucked them over. Well.. at least they still got paid, not like we walked out on them too ;)

Oh yeah, the music is poppin'!
author: Frankie W.

description: Came here recently with two friends and I loved it. It was my first time trying hookah outside of my home so I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised by the vibe. We tried the guava and lemon mint suggested by our waiter and it was damn good! We got there at about 8 and by 10 it was packed inside and out front get there early if you want to a good spot. Some cons for me would be the small space and it being cash only so be warned and prepared.
author: Beaky L.

description: This place had a wide selection of flavors and the server had great recommendations. The Turkish coffee was good too. It was a relaxing and fun place to hang out on the patio. We met the the owner and he was nice and informative. I'll definitely be back when I'm in town!
author: Mariel D.

description:
I came here once on a Friday night, my first time trying hookah. Its pretty chill, everyone was friendly and they have a variety of hookah flavors so that was good. I went with my friends and we order some smoothies, i order mango and it was really goood! 

Good service too, the only complain is that since the place was busy we had to wait for them to put more carbon or give us some attention. But its a cool place to chill i recommend trying it out.
author: Vale O.

description: Best shisha in the city! It's a little hole in the wall so its best to get here when there are no crowds.  I ordered lemon mint shisha which was really good and the arabic tea is to die for!!
author: Snoopy C.

description: Best hookah I've ever had. Hands down. The price is a bit high, though. $22(if I remember correctly) and only 3 or 4 people to a hookah. But, is it worth it? Yes. I recommend the angel something(I can't remember the name of it right now, because I went in July '12).
author: Ashley T.

description: Went late night on a Friday for some hookah. We had a group of 8, and there was no line outside. We finally got a table together and the server/owner said we had to get 4 hookahs or leave. That's one hookah per 2 people, which is excessive. We offered to get 3 instead, since 4 would just go to waste (normally a group this size needs only 2), and he still refused. Two of us don't even smoke and we offered to buy tea or food or coffee, but he still refused. Finally I decided to leave the group and go home so the rest of the group wouldn't get ripped off. He STILL made them get 4 hookahs for 7 people. All in all, very poor service. They are one of the few late night hookah places in SF, but I don't think I'll be going back.
author: Michael M.

description:
Worst hookah experience. Not from the area and found on yelp. Decided to give it a try. 
We had to sit outside because inside was full. Not that there were many people inside just small small place. Meanwhile outside every 2 mins getting asked for change by people walking right up to our table. It was a Saturday night around 10pm. HORRIBLE area. Clenched my purse to my side while trying not to make eye contact with the desperate poor roaming the area.

Hookah flavor was bad and they never came to check on coals.
author: Bailey H.

description: Kind of a hole in the wall but this place I definitely recommend. Parking garage is across the street, $10 bucks until midnight, it is your best bet, you don't really want to park your car around this neighborhood. The place had a great selection of flavors and also a tasty menu of cafe drinks. The prices were fair, we shared one hookah and ordered two chai teas only cost us about $24. Very intimate setting, kinda crowded because it's a small space but we had a great time, the owners are very nice men and run a fantastic spot.
author: Andy ..

description:
A wonderful experience! A comfortable, low-key environment, exactly what you would imagine for a traditional hookah bar. The shisha was tasty, and well-served; it lasted for about an hour, at which point the server came to change the coal promptly. The house-made milk tea was INCREDIBLE, slightly pricey and you have to wait (because the tea is home-brewed, over slowly heated milk), but well worth it!! The owner introduced himself at the end of the night, but refused to give away the "top secret" tea recipe.  Service was friendly, if a bit slow... but you don't come to a place like this if you're in a rush. 

One downside is the location; the constant parade of homeless people passing by can make you feel pretty bad about sitting their with your $20 hookah, trying to relax...
author: Sasha N.

description:
So THIS is what great shisha tastes like?! 

We walked into this hole in the wall, smack dab at midnight, and it was packed.  The manager said, "Two? Don't worry, I'll make room."
 
Squeezing my wide ass and my date between two other couples, we managed to sit down and find ourselves lost in a haze of sweet, sweet tobacco blowing in from all around us. We sat so close to other patrons, that we might has well have been having sex. I don't know if they minded the wide load, but they were extremely friendly.

I also found myself surrounded by an inferno of hookahs on both sides.  They put the hookahs on the floor for safety, so the tops of the burning coals were practically singing the hairs off of my (once) hairy arms. No more shaving for me!

We had the sour apple flavor and coming from my hot date that's never even touched tobacco, she said, "wow, this is great!"  We also ordered a small bit of arabic tea. and jee golly wizz it tasted as if you diluted a pound of sugar into each sip. I like sugar.

One of the servers, couldn't serve us anything but hot coals for some reason.  We had to ask the other for our shisha and sweet arabic tea when it appeared that the former server didn't understand anything but the universal sign language of pointing.

Aside from the lack of service and the cramped conditions, it was an awesome experience to finally understand what great hookah is all about.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
I love this place! My besties and me found this places after we could not get into Cairo Nights. When we got there around 11:30 it was not crowded but i guess that was because it had been raining that night. We came in an order one hookah and then another. Both favors were great; Guava and Cola. Cola tasted just like Coca Cola, my new favorite favor! You could really taste the favors while you were smoking it, the favor wasn't an after taste. 

The atmosphere was the best. It was chill and the music was perfect. They played Middle Eastern, Arabic and i think some Indian pop, with some American pop mixed here and there. It was not a club atmosphere and the crowd was a little bit older maybe in there mid-20s (perfect for me!). If your looking for an Americanized, club, and late teens atmosphere go to Cairo Nights, this is not the place for you.
author: Krystle S.

description:
I've been going to Nile on and off for a long time. Few years ago I wouldn't give it 4 stars, but since the owner stepped aside & realized he is not cut for customer service and got pros to run it for him, it became a completely different experience at Nile!! 
Their hookahs have been and still are, at least 4 stars. Hookahs are always clean, no leaks and topped with natural coals! 
To get your money's worth, stay away from Arabic tea, it's too expensive for no good reason. Hookah and coffee or smoothie is a much better choice. 
If you want a classier spot with same quality hookahs try Morac, but of course expect to pay much higher price..
author: Carl T.

description:
I walked by this place numerous times but always thought it's just a cafe until a friend brought me here for hookah. It must be some strange coincidence, all of a sudden, everyone I know smokes hookah... 

This place is cozy, warm, inviting and friendly while burning coal by the door and also outside that gives a very close relationship with the shop. 

The owner and the servers are very friendly. We had tea and double apple. All great and they kept coming by refilling the coal. They only have 1 sitting on the floor area but other areas are good too. Definitely a great to hang out with friends and socialize!
author: T L.

description: Prices posted were innacurate. Think the attendant was pocketing the difference. Rude, forgot our orders, hookah ordered was apple and blueberry, thought it tasted like licorice and soap. Think the african guy was high.
author: Peter L.

description:
Wow!  we've tried a other hookah lounges in the city, but this place... well, Nile Cafe... well... WOW!

Ok, let me attempt to spit out a few lines of why I loved this place.

Quality: The shisha was very smooth and so fragrant.  We also had two Turkish coffees, delivered to the table in the cevze/ibrik/briki/whatever-you-call-it.  The coffees were the best yet!  Pace yourself better than I did, though.  The coffee is so delicious, but sip it slowly since it's deceptively strong.

Service: The owner and his staff are all very attentive and pleasant.  They were really on top of things, especially the coal!  I like how they use broken-up pieces of coal... much more work for them, but a much better smoking experience than the larger coal discs.  Despite how busy he was, the owner didn't mind taking the extra minute to snap a photo of my boyfriend and me.  I also appreciated that the owner had a sincere smile on his face the whole night!  

Comfort:  Everything was very comfortable!  The seating was much better than other places we've been (*ahem* bar stools at Sunshine Coast, wtf?!? *ahem*).  The lounge is cozy and intimate.  We were never rushed, rather we felt encouraged to sit back and relax.  Perfect for a night with friends or with that special someone.
author: Christena T.

description: Its hard to find good hooka spots.  I own a smoke shop so I know cheap tobacco and coals when I see them.  I got to Nile Cafe and was pleasantly surprised.  The service was quick, they changed our coals often and the Arabic tea was strong and tasty.  The spot is a little small, but well worth the trip to the city to try it out.  Its open very late on the weekends too which is great....especially considering you can smoke after the clubs!
author: Naji E.

description: I give this place 3.5 stars, bc I was expecting a lot given that it had good reviews.  This place is smaller than it appears in the pics.  We got the white peach.  There wasn't much white peach in it, just smoke.  Our bowl became harsh after awhile.  Service was alright, could have been faster.  It took 15 min to get our bill.  However, despite all these, I will prolly go back later.  In SF, it's so hard to find a half decent hookah bar.  This one is decent, therefore, I will go back.
author: Alex G.

description:
This is the WORST hookah restaurant I have EVER been to. Do NOT come here. Go to Mela down the block because they actually know what they are doing and know how to treat customers.

My friends and I went to Nile last night and watched as three people that came after us went in before us. When we FINALLY got in (they said it would be 15 minutes and we waited a half hour) they crammed all ten of us into a tiny little corner and told us to "squish together." We ordered apple, white peach and guava and, after waiting another ridiculously long time period (i smoke hookah a lot. i know how long it takes.) they finally brought out guava, white peach and LICORICE. we figured it wasnt that big of a deal and continued to smoke. well, we TRYED. two of the hookahs didnt work for 90% of the night, despite the fact that we talked to them about the problem three times.

finally, everyone was just frustrated and wanted to leave. i thought i would try reasonably talking to the manager to express the fact that it seems a little unfair to pay for an entire hookah that no one smoked the entire night. i walked over to him and calmly expressed my feelings in a reasonable manner only to be screamed at back. he started yelling at me  saying that his hookahs worked, and that he could fix them. this service was just ridiculous. it was the WORST customer service experience i have EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.

FUCK YOU KENT. learn how to treat your customers.
author: Sammie S.

description:
This place is noooooo joke! It's legit and a great neighborhood place to chill out. We had a party of 7. We started out at a table but eventually moved to the small space in the window. The 7 of us snuggled closely together, smoked 2 hookahs, ordered tea and had a great time. It was SO relaxing and I could totally see myself doing this every now and then. Loved it! I highly recommend the apricot flavor! The young guy who tended our hookahs and tea was nice enough to accommodate us. 
The TV on the wall played Middle Eastern music videos. At one point a girl was rubbing kittens on her face. ? 
Mind you, this place of business is in the TL so be prepared for a show. When we were there a lady in a purple shirt was doing the leannnnnn. For those of your unfamiliar with the activities of the TL, the lean is when you're so high on heroin, you fall asleep standing up but then wake yourself up again every 15 seconds. Also, if you plan on sitting outside, forget smoking your hookah in peace. Take it from me- sit inside to avoid being hit up for $0.42 and a cigarette.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Thank you for helping me blacken my lungs in style.

The logo on the outside looks a bit like the Starbucks siren, though the crowd of misfits milling about Jones Street with their unique taste in fashion and vocabulary will set the record straight right quick.  You're in the hood, son.  But that doesn't mean we can't have us some smoke and argue about Jihad and Zion.  Hope you're not in a hurry.

They have pillows for you to sit on and they let you smoke inside, any time of day, no lame "after dinner only" or "outside only".  You see the good people of Egypt kicking it inside with a newspaper and a hookah, like it's their own living room.  Class.

If you're brave enough for the elements and the local gentry, they have these big censers they set up outside so the real pros can get their own charcoal straight from the pit of fire.  There was this guy with his own mouthpiece.  Looked like a cobra.  The mouthpiece, not the guy.  Hardcore.  

Did I mention they have like 30 flavors on the menu?  It's insane.  To be fair, they don't actually STOCK all of them.  And the blond foreign girl who was helping us was inept to the point of comedy, so I kept the order simple and the words small.  I will surely come back and try out the other flavors.  This beats Baskin Robbins any day of year.
author: Cassio P.

description:
One of my new favorite joints on one of my favorite blocks in the city. I went there tonight and smoked some smooth hookah and drank the best tea. 

The best thing is that, despite having a  blast, I have a drop of alcohol, so I'm gonna feel great in the morning. 

The space is small, but in my opinion that lends to the atmosphere of the place. 

I'll be back for sure..how could I not? It's next door to Shalimar and across the street from my parking garage.
author: Jason R.

description: This place totally sucks! The waiters are beyond rude and horrible service. They force you to sit at the table they desire. I'm an expert at hookah bars and I can guarantee you that this is the worst one I've been to. Avoid it at all costs!
author: Nora M.

description:
Tea is superb.  Shisha (Hookah/Nargila) is sublime.  There is nothing else there.  Sometimes I want to shake Kinani, the owner, and make him give me other yummy food and drinks.  He does not.

Sometimes I ask Kinani to let me use the secret door to go to the Happy Endings Massage Parlor upstairs.  Kinani does not like this joke.

In addition to the best tobacco flavors, Kinani has real charcoal.  Other places tell me the virtues of the smoldering plastic hockey puck that they serve.  He used to steal it from Shalimar's tandoor next door.  Now he has his own furnace of good taste.  Sometimes Kinani's dad is there.  This is an opportunity to practice one's good manners.  Sometimes there are young hot Arab women there.  More reason to polish up one's good manners.
author: jawad a.

description: I sometimes wish to MAGICALLY appear sitting down with my white peach shisha & a cup of the arabic house tea while watching stuffed & plucked lebanese singers on there TV.  This place puts me at my comfort zone.
author: Mia R.

description: This place was right across from the bar I went to so my friend and I ran across the street fOr some random hookah craving. We had smoothies and hookah. And it wasnt expensive. It was fun.
author: Elvira G.

description: Wow, it's so sweet to see this place succeeding.  It's owned by the cousin or inlaw of Hussein, who owns the corner liquor store up the block.  There's almost no cooking facility, it's such a tiny place, but they have some of this and that, some coffee.  Hookas, tables and umbrellas out on the street and in the window so you can while away the hours, a brave forray into one of the most cracked out blocks in town but also one of the most lively.  Think about this place for an after-joint to Shalimar, Millennium, Clift, Osha Thai, etc.
author: Gil S.

description: Clean Narghile and good coffee and great house tea, no baklava :-( but overall the best place to Hookah out.  Also they have outside seating (if you don't mind the homeless) that is great.
author: Peter K.

description:
Minus one star for jacking the prices. I'm not spending $60 for a group of 4... And it's gotten a little run down- not a fan of the place by the window. I went a few nights ago and saw a dead bug on the carpet. Fucking nasty. 
Minus another star for waiting 20 mins on a refill on a wednesday night.
author: Amanda S.

description:
First things first, kids-- The lovely thing about Nile Cafe is that you could potentially get a smoothie with your hookah-of-choice. The smoothie option remains a possibility-- kind of like getting extra large fries and a diet coke. Feels good. Honestly.

I wound up at the Nile after a friend completed the last day of the bar exam (hoooray bar!!). We rolled into the low-lit room to the sound of loud Middle Eastern fusion music, excellent live drumming and strumming by intoxicated patrons that decided to play over the fusion, and really entertaining Iranian music videos that...were sadly on silent. 

Best part about Nile?? The BYOB factor! Use it to your advantage-- have a 40z party while inhaling mint chocolate chip. Better yet-- sip a soothing RED STRIPE while you realize you just might lose an eardrum from the entertaining cacaphony and generally boisterous atmosphere.

Go with a large group of friends and enjoy-- just make sure you lock your car and hope it doesn't get jacked while you are indulging.
author: Yaamini R.

description:
I had a great experience here the other day. A frequenter of many hooka bars, I know what I'm looking for...and simple enough, it's the hooka! Quality, flavors, how big the smoke gets, can I make rings, etc. Well, maybe not all of those things have to be there. 

But they were definitely there at Nile Cafe, plus one more thing, which was great service. My friend and I got there quite early, and they had pretty much just opened. They were cleaning the place and making the nice "lounge" area clean for us and were friendly about it the whole time. I don't mind waiting if the service is friendly and I feel taken care of. They were almost too friendly and talkative but then totally left us alone too..I like that. Sometimes service can be too much, you just want to talk with your friend after awhile. It was a good balance here. 

After the lounge area was ready for us, the awesome factor went even farther up when I tried their house blend for hooka and was blown away by how good it was. Very smooth, they use good coal, and they refilled those coals like no other place I've ever been to! I'm anal, so I always ask..but I didn't have to ask here! My friend and I stayed for like 3 hours...literally. We were just so happy and relaxed there; I'm sure we'll make it one of our usual hangout spots after work, so I'll be back in no time. If you want exceptionally good hooka + quality service, this is a great place to try.
author: Nebula H.

description:
Awesome place to chill on some tea and hookah with a couple friends!  Beware of the 3 person per hookah limit.  I like that, a lot.  But if you've got a big group, stay away from here and go to Cairo Nights or some shit...

They play arabic music here and the owners are really nice!
author: Michael K.

description:
Very disappointing. The only star goes to the friendly woman behind the counter. 

So... it's after 10:00 PM on a Sunday, cabin fever has started to set in from sitting on me ass too long, and I think... what could we (me + boy) POSSIBLY do? I had Yelped hookah bars/lounges/whatever you call them a while back, and thought, maybe this was our only late night option for this evening. So why not? It's a cold night, I'm bored, so why not do a little lung damage?

Fast forward through a 25-minute car drive across the city to one of the crappiest neighborhoods San Francisco has to offer. Weaving through the dodgy crowd up a hill, we finally get to the Nile Cafe. We browse the menu, and quite reasonably decide we don't want to pay $20 for a hookah when they were closing in about an hour. Between two people that's a little steep... so, we'll just have a seat and order a pot of tea and a smoothie instead. And perhaps hang out for a half hour at most. Harmless enough, right?

So when the otherwise kind gentleman comes over to take our order, we politely explain that we didn't want to get a hookah but we wanted to order drinks instead. They (he) wouldn't let us! They said we couldn't order, or sit down, without getting a hookah. So we had to leave so we didn't take up valuable table real estate. Because any moment now, a flood of patrons would ensue and we would be hogging one of the ten empty tables? I don't know. 

Being a hookah lounge virgin I cannot comment on the establishment's overall impressiveness, but the boy insisted that of all the lounges he's been to, that was by far the crappiest and most expensive one he had seen. Duly noted.

So fast forward through another 25-minute drive home, filling the car with mumbles of "that was dumb" and "how retarded" and "fucking lame. I'm going to leave them a bad Yelp review, dammit." 

And, here it is.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Undoubtedly the best hookah lounge I've been to so far.

I visited Nile Cafe with two of my friends at 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon, wanting to try their hookah before the place got too crowded. The place is a bit small, but the owner doesn't really have a problem with it: the location of the building is very accessible as it's only three blocks away from Union Square.

The atmosphere of the place was great: Bob Marley sang through the speakers while a handful of sexy Middle Eastern music videos played on the plasma TV. And I agree with the consensus: the owner is super friendly and loves to chat without imposing on your friends' session. He suggested that we try a bowl of the house mix (Nile Mix 2), which I thought was a very delicious blend of fruity flavors and a hint of mint. Contrary to my friend's preconceived notion, it was nothing at all like smoking menthols; the mint was very subtle and even enhanced the taste of the fruit. The best part was, the owner didn't give us a time limit: we stayed at Nile for a good hour and a half, with a renewal of (legitimate, not prepackaged) coals halfway through.

Nile Cafe may be my new hookah joint. This place is worth its word-of-mouth advertising.
author: Daryl L.

description:
beware, the place is tiny.  that being said, you've got to love the hookahs, the house tea, and their turkish coffee.

the 4-stars is for the neighborhood, not the best place in the city, but i don't mind.

try and get there early if it's on the weekend.  again, it's a small place and once it gets packed, who knows what the wait time is going to be.

as for Hookahs, the Double Apple is awesome, just make sure to keep on the guy running coals, as he sometimes seems to get distracted easily.
author: Mike S.

description:
The guava lemon mint is lovely, not too sweet, not too bland, it lasts long, and it tastes so fresh.
The spot is intimate; the staff is friendly and attentive. 
Real coals make all the difference.
The tea is excellent. It's warm, sweet, it tastes comfy (if that's possible).
Nile Cafe, The best hookah bar at 2:30am is a wonderful end to a long night.
author: Shanna H.

description: The hookah is the best I've ever smoked, and the tea is awesome too. Check this place out if you want an authentic hookah experience.
author: Sean A.

description:
I LOVE this place. I went here for the first time on Friday, and I found it very chill, unpretentious, and overall a very friendly hookah bar. Even if you don't smoke hookah, you can try their AMAZING tea. I swear, the best I ever had. I went with some friends, and I drank the whole pot of tea literally before they even had half of the pot. The manager was a super-chill guy, and I met these two guys who worked there, Vijay and David. Vijay was really nice, and David was uber interesting to talk to. Even if you don't really have anything to do, you can pretty much talk to David (who's a really interesting guy from East Africa) all night long (if they're not too busy) without getting bored and without the usual awkward silences, I swear. 

The only iffy of the night was a high school girl (I know!) who decided I was being unfriendly and picked a fight with me. I was like "chill" and it was sort of funny how she got really mad at me in retrospect. that's how chill this place is. I literally forgot about how I nearly had my first catfight after some quality hookah and tea. How fitting it was to be this chill place to have my first fight (kinda).
author: Janet W.

description:
The perfect place to relax and chill out after the thrills of walking through the Tenderloin.  The oft-raved about house tea, though tasty, was a little sweet for me, especially since we were smoking sweet shisha.  Maybe the Lemon Mint would have been a preferable complement over Nile mix 1 (our server wouldn't tell us anything more about the mix besides that it's "fruity" - having smoked it, I don't have much more detail to offer.)  So many flavors!  

It's a tiny spot, but there's a lot going on to provide entertainment - a pillowed area near the front window for max-relaxin, and some booths near the back with a TV playing india-sexy music videos that don't correspond with the music in the cafe.  The music that's actually playing is a hilariously random selection.  When I went there was a really excellent bongo player who occasionally interrupted his puffs to bang along when he felt moved to do so.  And there was a drunk girl who shares my name (kind of rare) who kept introducing herself and shimmying suggestively to the bongoing.  Entertaining indeed.
author: Natalie S.

description:
My friend has been telling me about this place since I met him, and today I finally got a chance to check it out.  Located in what he has dubbed the 'tandoor-loin', it was rather nondescript, but could be quickly picked out once we looked for the little sun shaped sign protruding from the wall.  As we walked in I first noticed the tidy, near-eastern feel of the place.  It may be small but it certainly didn't feel it.  How they did this without mirrors I do not know, though I admit it was a bit early and therefore not very busy.  My friend and I opted for a seat around the floor hookah stand (the rest of the hookahs are seating only but I'll take pillows on the floor anytime) and ordered the jasmine flavor which he so highly recommended.  Though the owner tried to dissuade us, directing us to the tamer 'fruit' flavors, we stuck by our choice, and did not regret it.

Having tried their shisha before (you can buy some to take home) I knew to expect a very flavorful experience.  However, trying it from one of their beautiful hookahs heated with real coals was something else again.  I am being completely honest here when I say that the shisha itself lasted over an hour before dying down.

Try the tea.  It was hot.  It was spiced.  It was delicious.  He asked us what we thought of it, and we replied emphatically that it was delicious.  When we asked the man (owner, I assume) what was in it he vaguely cited 'african spices' as the ingredients which gave it that special oomph.  It may have been just us but we both agreed that we tasted clove in there somewhere.  And it was undoubtedly sweetened with cane sugar and not the 'refined' stuff one normally encounters nowadays.  Absolutely delicious, I only wish I could have brought some home with me.
 
My friend, who had never been there during the day before, said the atmosphere was much different at night.  Though I took this to mean a night time jaunt would result in an improved experience, I was more than satisfied with the day time vibe.  However, now that I've been here once, I absolutely must come again.  And next time with a group- because unlike some places, the tables here (though few in number) are quite accommodating.
author: Nicolas M.

description:
There are times when you just want to chill, away from the bustling club scene and rude people.  This is the place to do it.  Brought some Red Stripe and ordered Guava, tres good.  Tutti fruiti, not my fave.  Donnie, the owner is awesome and let us stay as long as we wanted.  He hooked it up w/ some tea (chai honey?).  Whatever it was, it tasted like nirvana.  Nile Cafe is definitely a jewel. :) 

They have a really clean bathroom too! 6th star
author: Joellene B.

description: This is such a cute place!  I did not know it was small though.  We had traditional cherry hookah and it was amazing!  Total cost was about $16.00.  I would definitely come back on a Thursday night to chill.  Great place!
author: Sarah H.

description:
I love hookah joints and own one myself but the reviews really let me down on this one. I went in here with a friend last Monday evening. We ordered a hookah and it didn't pull right. i asked for more coals which helped a little but it wasn't the amount of smoke that I'm used to in other places. 

To top it all off, the single bowl was 16 dollars! wow. I've never paid more than 8 dollars for a bowl so that really blew my mind.

It's a small cramped place and luckily there were only two other groups with us. The 2 stars is because the staff was very friendly and they gave us complimentary very tasty tea. 2 stars for hospitality.
author: Adam C.

description: Came here on a sat night after a disappointing hr of waiting in line at Ruby Skye and not getting in.  Boy did this place save our night, pretty small, but cute little cafe that was only 2 blocks away.  The atmosphere was really nice, they had music playing that wasn't annoying or too loud to talk over, and I loved the floor corner with all the cushions where we sat.  Hookah and service was great, I'll have to try some of their drinks next time I come here.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Kinani's shisha is like smoking Valium (in a good way).

Take your shoes off.
author: Fattfreddie F.

description: Excellent spot.  Typing this up while I enjoy a nice cup of Arabic tea and some Sheeshah.  I was looking for a spot like this for ages in SF and finally discovered it.... phew.  A backpacker's stop for a quick rest. All this after a super sweet meal at Shalimar (right next door).
author: Manny F.

description: This little place is cute. We showed up around 3ish in the morning, where people were just starting to leave. We had a plum flavor because white peach was out. I ordered a chai latte and HOLY SHIT it was the best thing ever. I have never had anything so good. I even asked the owner what he put in the chai to make it so good and he responded with "it's a sceret" Kind a creepy huh? Anyways, I'd go back for the drinks and I feel that the place could be a little bit cleaner.
author: Ozzy A.

description:
Very good hookah. Very nice and helpful service.
We were surrounded by many businessmen and the place was packed, but the owner made it so 7 of us could sit. All the other folks around were super nice too. 
We had a special blend of melon and vanilla and it was very very tasty. 
We were there for over an hour and the smoke kept billowing nice and smooth. 
Pair this place with Shalimar down the street and it is a tasty, relaxing night for all!

Free WiFi and apparently awesome tea (i will try it next time, for sure!) makes The Nile a keeper.
author: Amy J.

description:
My friends and I got the hankering for hookah, as they had recently got addicted to the stuff. We found this place on yelp and went searching for it. 

It's a tiny little hole in the wall, but we could smell it from Geary street. Yum. They had plenty of flavors of shisha and for a small fee, could mix flavors. And prices were VERY reasonable (15-20$ a flavor) for good quality tobacco. We tried the tutti-frutti. It must have lasted us an hour without getting harsh. The mint tea was very very good and also very sweet. Yum. I think we'll be regulars to this place soon. :)))

The owner was very friendly too. He asked us where we found Nile and we said "Yelp.com!"
author: Regina L.

description:
This has a great, mellow atmosphere.

I recommend the "Nile Mix" and a little pot of Turkish coffee.

It makes for a lovely, social evening!
author: Brock H.

description: A++ rating across the board, I came up from LA for the weekend and located this amazing hooka lounge. The shishe was fantastic, everything was good from the tobacco to the coal to the good service. If you are high maintenance an want food and someone waiting on you every two minutes this is NOT the place for you..if you want a good atmosphere with reasonably priced hooka and good service look no further,,.. Ali is a really nice guy who works there and he makes a tremendous pipe!! Enjoy!
author: David I.

description:
The hookah is great. They use real coal instead of the instant light crapy coals that other places use. Ask the owner for his special tobacco mixes, really good stuff.

You must try the tea with your hookah. I'm sure you will love it.
author: Mohammad M.

description:
Great Place to hangout at in the Tenderloin!
Smooth sheesha!
Fantastic tea!
Random entertainment!
author: Steve A.

description:
First things first, if you can't handle this part of the TL then you have no business being here. Sure the block isn't the best, but it's far from the worst the `loin has to offer.

Second, if your idea of a good time is you and your 19 best friends (how you could have 19 best friends is beyond me) you obviously aren't going to enjoy the charm of an intimate place such as the Nile Cafe. Like others have noted, go find yourself some commercial hookah bar someplace else where you can fit in with the crowd.

However, if you can appreciate the fact that while this is in the `loin, and is not the best place for a large crowd, please go to the Nile Cafe. They have a fantastic selection of tobacco (Shisha, or Sheesha is another name for hookah, not the tobacco) and the house tea is a marvelous compliment to your smoke. I've tried over 10 of the varieties on the menu and have never once been disappointed, they're all fantastic.

The owner is one of the most gregarious guys who, regardless of how many people he sees in a month/year will remember you if you weren't a jerk. The guy is fantastic and actually handed out bottles of Martinelli's on New Years to people who got a hookah.

All in all, if you can handle walking through a neighborhood that's about as San Francisco as any other normal neighborhood (you really aren't in any danger on this block)  and can handle the intimate venue, you will be rewarded with one of the best atmosphere's for enjoying a relaxing hookah.
author: N S.

description: Great Hookahs, in a nice cozy location off Geary. You must try the Tea, it really makes the experience much more authentic, and enjoyable. They have multiple flavors to choose from, so you can't go wrong with any one. They recently just added an outdoor area, which is really nice to do when the weather is nice in SF.
author: Ryan P.

description: Very authentic hookah bar feel, like the hookah bars I went to in Morocco. Simple seating, strong hookahs. Lovely cha (tea) options. Sketchy neighborhood but great Turkish food everywhere around regardless.
author: Brinda G.

description:
The Nile is a great place to relax, sip tea and smoke the hookah with friends.  Their tea is fantastic and they have a huge menu of different flavored tobaccos.  Though, they never bring me what I order.   The guy who runs it is so nice and he always reassures me that he gave me "something special."  Fair enough.  

The atmosphere is very conducive  to smoking the hookah.  No shoes, big pillows on the floor, weird music videos playing on the tele, men laying around, speaking in foreign tongues.
 
It is almost a shame that i was recently gifted my very own hookah courtesy of Rachel H.
author: Alexis M.

description:
Love, love , love the white peach!! Hmmm.....so good!!!
We went on a Saturday night and got a floor seat by the window so that was really cool! Service is a bit on the slow side. Price is reasonable. Music is good. The cafe is small, full of people, has outside seating, kinda dark, a bit dirty.... Definitely worth coming back (although I try not to come back twice for a place in SF) and try their tea!!
author: Gabriele A.

description: Nile Cafe has a variety of good hookah flavors as well as tasty drinks. Their house tea and chai tea lattes are some of my favorites. There is a good atmosphere and fun music playing. Can be very busy on weekends at night before and after people go to bars.
author: Ryan G.

description: Great hookah, good tea. Just took forever to get served and the place is way too small.
author: Jabeen R.

description: This is the kind of place to go relax and have a conversation with friends. The music is very chill and the shisha flavors are all very tempting. I actually convinced my buddies to go with "Sex on the Beach" and no one had complaints! It's also a great place to people watch. I can't wait to come back!!!
author: Lisa R.

description: this place was great. they didn't have much drinks there when i went. hookah hits pretty good, service was good, and the music was ok. .. the price of hookah was pretty much the same price as san jose  20 bucks.
author: Jewl B.

description:
A Hookah Lounge in downtown San Francisco?  I gotta check that out!
Step into the door, everyone is relaxed in the dark middle eastern atmosphere.  They have couches piled with elegant pillows and intricately designed hookahs.

When you get the menu of the shisha selection, you are probably going to be overwhelmed by it.  I asked for the house special and the house tea, which both consist of secret ingredients...  It was good though.  I definitely recommend the tea which is very sweet.

The employees were cool, but service was a bit slow.  We ended up waiting anywhere from 20-30 minutes to light up and a pot of tea.  Overall, I thought that this place was small and stuffy, but the quality of product was good.
author: Walter C.

description:
After a late dinner at Katana-ya, we walked back up to Geary to Hotel Adagio where we were staying. It was our first night in the city and we were not quite ready to crawl into bed so we decided to walk around the block and check out the interesting, somewhat sketchy Tenderloin district. By the way, I don't recommend doing this unless you're with someone that will be ready to kick some ass...in this case, I had my boyfriend. 

We stumbled into the Nile Cafe shortly after we made a left on Jones street. A guy ushered bright red coals from the side of the street to his customers sitting on the patio. The sweet hookah smoke and techno-like Arabic music sneaked through the little door. Right at that moment, we knew we're up for an adventure. Luckily, we were able to find a corner area to ourselves in the small, crowded cafe. The environment was lively, yet intimate. Loud, yet relaxing. 

Since we had no idea what to do other wanting to smoke some hookahs, we let the owner decides for us. He gave us the Nile mix for the hookah and tea. The tea was like Indian chai tea without the milk...sweet with a cinnamon, cardamon flavor. The hookah tasted just the same and we were very happy. We sat on some semi-comfy cushiony seats, drank 3 pots of tea, smoked, and people watched. It was the most relaxing and fun thing we could've done that night. 

Anyway, I just love this place! It's local, it's genuine, and the owner and server were very friendly (true from other reviews). Next time, I am bringing a deck of cards or some silly games with me to play!
author: J B.

description:
Decided to hit up a hookah place while in the city and looked up the reviews for a place and found that Nile Cafe wasn't too far from where we were. (although we accidentally ended up walking through the Tenderloin, which was totally fun) we still enjoyed our time here. 

We got two hookahs and flavors (they do a up to 3 people per hookah rule and since we had 6, ya you do the math). We had the Triple Apple (which I didn't like that much because the after taste was too much like licorice) and the Sunkist (which was a light orangey/fruity flavor). 

We had the booth in the front with the pillows on the ground and it was comfy for some of us (the corners) and not so comfy for others. The tv was blasting some awesome music videos/movies, totally reminded me of where I grew up. 

Its not that big of a place so it does get a bit crowded so I would come a bit earlier and hang out for a few hrs before going out in the city. We definitely had some fun and great conversations over some sweet hookah. :)
author: Erin B.

description: I am by no means an expert on hookah, I indulge once in a while, normally with friends just to relax and chat. So go figure I love the atmosphere of this place and the cafe portion. I went last night and admittedly not able to take deep pulls of the hookah so instead I enjoyed the adeny tea. WHICH IS DELICIOUS. My friend and I split two pots of this delicious tea and it was so good. Go, if not for the music, or the hookah then do it for the tea. They serve espresso drinks and coffee, but the tea is where the gold is.
author: Shauna S.

description: Friendly staff, nice teas and hookah. I really liked the place.
author: dogan kaya b.

description:
In one word, perfect.

The shisha at this classic hangout is the best in the United States--and maybe even in the world. With real charcoal and over 75 different flavors to choose from, the sky is the limit.

Whether you're looking for the classic double apple or something a little more adventurous--try the fakhfahina--this is the place. Be sure to check out the tea and the Turkish coffee.

Go. Be seen. Have a night to remember. It's worth it!
author: Matthew P.

description: This is what a hookah lounge should be, lots of arab music, arab tv, the best cardamom tea I've had in ages and really good smoke... the only thing that got me was the bench seating, not terribly comfortable, should've lay on the floor/dais near the entrance with the pillows...
author: Len S.

description: Very cool little place. Extremely friendly staff. Would definitely come back.
author: Tony M.

description: First time ever going to the Nile Cafe, I must say I liked it.  I can see myself returning again, and again.   The Chai Tea Latte was AMAZING!! I woke up craving one this morning.  The Hookah was tasty, no complaints there.  I wish they would serve some finger foods, because after about an hour of puffin on the hookah my stomach started to feel a little queezy.  I cant wait to go back and try some new flavors!
author: Krystal D.

description:
Went to the Nile Cafe the other day with a buddy. A decent Hookah bar in the middle of the City. Although slightly pricey it was top notch shisha being imported from Dubai. The hookahs them self were very nice and not like many shabby ones you tend to see else where. 

My friend and I got one of the mixed flavors called "Obama" made by one of the employees. I recommended to him that he package it as is and sell it cus it was that good. I also recommend the house tea. 

The employees and owner were great. While the service and atmosphere were very decent. Plenty of plush pillows to go around. The only potential downfall of the Nile Cafe is its location hidden within the Tenderloin. But still wont keep me from coming back.
author: Adam S.

description:
Been here several times and each time I enjoyed myself. The hookah is very tasty and I think they put ice in their base because the smoke is very cool/chilled. The have a pretty big menu for hookah. Prices are average ( 15 dollars a pop and 17-18 for certain mixes ). I'd come here again but hopefully on a night and time where it isn't TOO crowded. You have the choice of sitting inside or outside, and we've done both. They have this comfy little seating in the front where it's carpeted with many throw pillows and you have to take off your shoes before you enter the carpet seating. Very relaxing when you just want to kick back and smoke some tasty shisha. =)

Their house tea is REALLY good. It's chai, gingery and slightly sweet. mmm..
author: Bonita C.

description:
My friend and I were looking desparately at 1:30am for a place to cap off the night's festivities.  Dropped off deep in the 'loin, there was no doubting our ability to run into some sort of late night score...

Like a surreal real-life episode of "I Dream of Jeannie", a waft of smoke obscured our path and thick tendrils of the haze beckoned us to step into Nile Cafe.

Although the place had cleared out, the owner was more than happy to let us lounge hedonistically on the pillow strewn floor while he hookahd us up with some very nice blackberry shisha.  Though I'm not a  smoke guru, I will admit the flavors were intense and long-lasting.  Add to that an insanely tasty house tea and we were steaming ourselves into a completely altered state.

We had a great conversation with the owner, and learned about the history of the place as well as his aspirations for the future.  Meanwhile I was puffing away like some wisened sage from lands farther east than Danville...  Dig anyplace that makes be feel "wisened".

I give this place an A for the classiness of management, an A for the quality of their product and a B for the location and layout.  I certainly hope this guy brings the love to the East Bay - we are in dire need of something to make us feel cool over here.
author: Brett L.

description: Great atmosphere, hookah is good (but avoid the overrated Obama blend). I recommend the coffee, chai tea lattes are tasty.
author: Mario C.

description: This place is pretty cool compared to the other hookah spots in town. One things for sure is that it isn't as crowded as many of the other spots; Cairo Nights in particular. Great place to hangout and "chill" with your buddies. Hookah is fantastic as well. Customer Service is much better than other places; they actually come regularly to replace your coals unlike other places where you have to keep going up to ask the employees to come do it. If the $10 hookah deal was until late night, it would be the best spot! Go and try it for yourself :)
author: Moe L.

description:
A better than average hookah bar in a city that lacks in many hookah options. Service is always somewhat slow, but it's hookah, you're there to relax, not grab a quick smoke over lunch. The shisha is just fine, the tea is pretty good, and while small the atmosphere is enjoyable enough. I've not been on any crazy busy nights, but it's usually got a few people, but not too bad. Wifi rounds out the mix, though I've only used it once. All of this is tempered by the fact that it is pricey as hookah places go. 

Honestly I was going to give this four stars but had to adjust it down to three. A lack of major negatives but a lack of big positives makes this a solid "Alright" in my book. Check it out if you don't want to deal with louder crowd at Cairo Nights.
author: Scott R.

description: Inexpensive and serves a long lasting hookah. No food, but they usually let us bring our own from Shalimar next door.
author: Jono S.

description: Your typical hookah bar with middle easter videos of belly dancers, lots of arabic men and smokey, great hookah. Obama is my favorite.  I hope it doesn't close down like most other SF hookah bars.  Check it out now before it's too late!
author: Ava D.

description:
I stopped by here on Thursday night with a few of my friends.  The place wasn't hard to find and there seems to be decent parking around.  Just be careful, I knew by looking at the address that it wasn't the hottest location as its in the Tenderloin.  Not the worst neighborhood but definitely not the best.  Lots o characters hanging out if that's your thang.

The joint wasn't that large and only two other parties were  here.  Pretty chill setting.  I'd say there's about roughly 5-6 tables to sit at.  We sit down and ask for a menu.  He handed us a menu with roughly 50 flavors.  We got our hooka pipe quit and smoked for roughly an hour and a half.  

It is also a cafe as my friends and I were able to get coffee and some Arabic Tea which was pretty good.  There's more selection for food and drink but  we didn't partake in any of it.  I'd definitely come back here and the people working here were cool and helpful.  It was also cool to not have to get up but request you get more coal by just turning my head.
author: Jason Y.

description:
A boy and I went there to smoke some hookah. We were really excited to tryt this place out as both of us are some veteran hookah smokers (can we say that??). Anyway, the service was a tad bit slow in the beginning, but soon we were greeted by a charming employee named Vijoy (Spell?), and he fully entertained us, and I got the feeling that he genuinely wanted to get to know us a little bit. Oh, he also got us coals. We had guava flavored tobacco and towards the last hr, the hookah smoked fabulously. Oh, and can't forget the scantily clad persian women on zhe mtv....

It's a great spot- close to everything downtown/union square/ hotel, but not pretentious, and very down to earth place. We ended up picking up some tobacco and coals- fully enjoyed everything about this place!
author: Mihae J.

description:
If you go to Dottie's and find a line halfway down the street when you get there, try this cafe, which is what I did. 

The atmosphere is slightly lacking, or at least it was when we were two of the few people in the place, but the service is helpful and friendly. My companion and I shared a veggie taster (big enough for two) and it was delightful. I heartily recommend their iced tea which is spiced instead of the regular black tea brew.
author: Michelle J.

description:
Ehh, the  hookah prices are a little high, the tea pot they bring to the table is tiny, and the seating is so uncomfortable,  but overall this is a nice place with a friendly owner. With a few improvements it could be great.

I've been here twice, last time there was a Saudi guy playing dotar (a long guitar) and a girl belly dancing. She put on quite a show.
Yes, I've had much better hookah, but the crowd here is fun, which makes for a pleasurable experience.

Parking is a nightmare, travel in groups.
author: tara n.

description: This is a cute place with some interesting (non-alcoholic) drinks. However the quality of the hookah is not that good and because of poor ventilation they always have to leave the door open which means you are freezing most of the time!
author: Jeremy H.

description:
the price is high, the hookah taste is not so much,,,
and place is small and noisy,,, not very much for a joy-able hookah
author: Ckoka C.

description:
I LOVE coming to Nile Cafe with my friends and just relax. They have the best hookah in town and the best customer service. Kan is always interacting with us and making sure that we're doing great. His staff are always very attentive and helpful carrying huge smiles whenever I see them. 
Prices are very affordable and its obvious that customers not only enjoy the yummy teas and awesome hookah, but they also enjoy the atmosphere that Kan and his staff have created for us. They are so laid back and always remember their customers. If the place is full, then they try to make it work creating a very homey atmosphere.
author: Veronica G.

description: Great find on the same block as one of my favorite restaurants Shalimar. Long waits for a table at Shalimar. So what did we do? We checked in with the manager at Nile Cafe and ask him if we ordered take out could we eat it there. As long as we ordered a hookah it was fine with him. It turned out to be the perfect way to end another long awaited lovely sunny day in the Bay. Fine food, fine company and fine hookah atmosphere. Try the house tea, cold or hot. The sweetness mixed with the cardamom awakens yet comforts the senses. Can't wait to drop by again.
author: Farah S.

description: Stopped by here for some tea. Tried the Morroccan Tea which was very good. They also have a wide variety of Sheesha flavors. Did not have time to try it out, but they have "Al Fakher" brand which is pretty good brand of Sheesha. Will have to come back and try it out next time I'm in the area!
author: Irfan R.

description:
Going to Nile Cafe was like dying and going to sheesha heaven! I'm from the East Coast and I wanted to make sure I would have plenty of hookah while I was in San Francisco, so I did some research online and found this place. The reviews on Yelp were very positive so I decided to give it a try since I consider myself a sheesha expert. I've smoked in all corners of the world and I must say that I was really impressed with the hookahs and tobacco at Nile Cafe. There is a wide variety of flavors, but I decided to stick to my usual double apple and mint and it was amazing. Later on I decided to check out "sex on the beach" flavor and even though I'm not much of a fruity flavor smoker, I really enjoyed this one. 

The place is small, but it's very cozy.  And sometimes you end up chatting with the people next to you which is pretty cool. And of course no one will bother you if you'd rather not socialize with the others. There's also an area where you can sit on the floor, which is perfect for larger groups. The owner there is an awesome guy who's very friendly and always tries to accommodate everyone. It's just a very chill atmosphere. 

I had a list of other cafes I wanted to try out while in the Bay area, but I decided against it since this place was just perfect. The owner was so sweet that he would let me try the hookah HE was smoking just to see if I liked the mix he had made. And if I did, he'd make me the same one. The Nile Mix is good too if you want something light and a little fruity. 

Also, this place doesn't serve food so the one review on here about food doesn't make sense. The owner of this cafe only serves drinks. He makes pretty good lattes and the tea here is amazing. 

And for those of you who consider yourselves experts in the sheesha department...this place uses natural coal which makes the flavor even better. They don't use the fast lite kind of coal. 

I was a bit worried about the location of the place after reading a few reviews on here that said the area wasn't the best. I asked my friend and she confirmed this, but when we went we felt fine and we weren't scared for our lives or anything like that. There's also a police station down the road so...yah you might see some strange people walking around, but you'll be fine. There's also a parking garage right across from the cafe which was pretty convenient!

This place definitely deserves 5 stars. Go there and you definitely won't be disappointed. The owner is awesome and he'll hook you up. 
I'll always remember this place as having damn good sheesha and would recommend it to all my hookah-loving friends.
author: Na3Na3 L.

description:
good place to wind down or hang out late night.  place opens til 4am some nights/all nights.  small cramped space but hookah's pretty good.

favorites i've had here...obama...some other mix...hookah prices are average [i think about $15-$18].  loud middle eastern music :] i like it.  i like their arabic tea [it's on the sweet side though for those of you who might not like it].  maybe you could ask for a sample before you get a larger size.  told the owner there was a particular flavor we weren't thrilled about once and he took it into consideration.  asked us for some input on why and things like that.  it's in the tenderloin so go with some brave friends if you're afraid of crackheads and strays that hang out around the block.  it's not bad though lol
author: J K.

description: I have lived in SF for a long time and this place has the best service and style you could find in the finacial district.... They have remodeled the tables and chairs and it much more improved and is friendly and convenient from where I work.  The owner is very accomidating and helps everyone and always welcome me there! Thanks Nile this review is for you guys!
author: Adriana C.

description: I loved this place so much that we went two days in a row. Right when it opens around 4pm, nobody's there, you've got the place to yourself and you can watch the "Now That's What I Call Arabia" music videos on repeat. The "Obama" flavor was excellent, and our coals were changed three times while we were there, without us even asking for it. Plus the house tea and the green tea smoothie are excellent beverage choices.
author: Nika S.

description:
i love LOVE how they have a extended list of shisha. my favorite is probably the guava. i also love their exotic spiced teas. yummy! the place is so chill & cozy...it can just get a bit tight & crowded which gets a lil annoying when u  have to scoot ur seat in so ppl can walk by.

i gotta come by next time to try their mint chocolate chip :P

i bought my very own hookah after visiting this place. lovess it!

:)
author: Rosalynn D.

description: Their Arabic tea is some of the best that you could taste. Especially when its brewed with milk. This was my favorite spot during my last trip to the Bay Area. The place is very cozy making it a great winter spot.
author: Ahmed H.

description: It's chill but also lively. The small yet roomy interior came alive when the DJ/Owner turned up the volume and a designated tabla player started matching the beat. The choice of flavors for the charcoal is overwhelming and off the hook-ah. The owner and his dad were really friendly and showed us how to properly toke it and smoke it. Was entertaining having a smoke exhaling contest with them, as well. They even allowed one of us to bring in alcohol from a liquor store right around the corner...they just don't serve it. Neighborhood isn't as bad as some say, it's just not for the fainthearted.
author: Chris C.

description: This place was great. We went the day after new year's and didn't have to wait long for anything. The employees were very kind. The guava was good. The house specialty tea was pretty good too. We sat where we wanted. We might've gotten points for having an Arab guy with us though.
author: Sharee R.

description:
So, I've been to about 10 different hookah lounges in 3 states. And while i think Yelp is an awesome site, I have always been a little bit hesitant to join. However, after my experience last night as this pathetic excuse for a hookah lounge, I felt motivated enough to actually join. So, what's so bad?

1. Crappy and shady area. However, can't really blame this on the hookah bar. And I've been to shadier places (that were WAY better). So it is excused from this accusation.

2. Ambience- Very cheesy. If I could come up with an analogy, it would be Cafe Nile: Middle Eastern :: Taco Bell: Mexican. 

3. Service- Employees are EXTREMELY rude and if you try to ask for help or attempt to get them out of their routine, they respond with extreme arrogance. Manager is a stress-nut who cannot handle customers questioning the service. 

4. Hookah quality- There are plenty of positive review on Yelp about the quality of hookah here which makes me wonder just how experienced the people reviewing Cafe Nile are. Coals are red hot and abundant but flavors of tobacco is mediocre at best and hookahs are the ones you can buy at an outlet plaza for about 40 or 50 bucks. Not worth it for 15 dollars per hookah. 

5. Food- I didn't actually order food but from the looks of both the plates and faces of customers who did order food, it looked like food you could get at a food court in a mall. Again, think Taco Bell for Middle Eastern. 

Overall, this is the absolute WORST hookah lounge I have been to and I would highly recommend one of the neighboring lounges over this sorry excuse for a Hookah lounge. Go to Cairo Nights.
author: Vadim B.

description: Very cool spot...I stumbled in this cozy little nook one night after eating after at the Indian Restaurant across the street. We were able to get a nice little couch/ table spot and inhale away. I felt totally dreamy after leaving the favors were great and the complimentary tea was awesome. Very nice crowd of people too, what more could one ask for?
author: Leslie A.

description: Delicious flavors, cozy, tobacco didn't give me a headache, and owner Ronnie (I think that's his name) was welcoming. He treated me like a friend which is rare in the city. I would love to return. This place was the perfect ending to my Girls night out.
author: Nelly Y.

description:
Lean back and enjoy an exotically flavored hookah while listening to Arabic business men conduct their deals.  At several points in the evening, my companion and I were the only ones speaking English - everything, including the television made us feel as if we were in the middle east.  They have 23 different flavors for the hookah and are willing to combine flavors. 
Ken, the owner, was amazingly helpful and friendly.  He let us know that he makes the tea from scratch.  It was so good that I couldn't bring myself to try the banana milk, but I suspect its a must as everyone in the cafe had one.  (The coffee was also superb.)  The food was very good, but different from an Ethiopian meal that one might get at the much missed Blue Nile.  The flavors are similar, but the presentation and ingredients were different.  I'm not certain if its more of an influence from the middle east that I've had with Ethiopian food in the past or if its a greater emphasis on fresh produce.  
I almost don't want to post this review, as I'd love this little gem to remain private, but must share.
The decor is modern - clean lines and bright paint.  It's also small, but its great.  A perfect first stop before hitting the tender nob bars, or a great place to wrap up the evening.  (Closes at midnight Fri & Sat).
author: She-Ra ..

description: Ok This place just popped up on yelp 30 min ago and I thought it was a fake review. So I decided to call the place and it does exist. I ordered the Sega Ferefer (Meat dish moistened with ingera-Ethiopian bread) and let me tell you it is gooooood. The place is set up like a coffee shop with the usual coffee,late etc but they also serve Ethiopian and Mediterranean food on a limited menu. The decor inside is simple and clean. It would be a great space if you live in the Tendernob and want to hang out at a discreet coffee shop that is not popular yet. I will definitely go back to get food to go.
author: Teddy d.

description: my last few visits were hugely disappointing... the service and hookah quality have gone downhill, while the prices went up... next!
author: Yaz S.

description: Awesome hospitality here and the seating areas in this small space are so cozy and clean.  Gold stars for that soothing herbally sweet tea AND the shiny samovar it arrived in.  We had the apple flavor, but must try out all the other flavors soon enough.  I'm just sayin, what a pleasant alternative--for everyone-- to smoking cigarettes.  It lasts longer and you can do it indoors-- perfect for those philosophical discussions that should last longer than your tolerance for standing out in the cold wet sf night as you burn the last drag to the filter.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Great place to go after you've left the bars / clubs. Went there on a Thursday night after going to Slide. Loved it. We had the GUAVA flavored hookah, and it was one of the best tasting flavors I've ever had. It was a nice place to chill, relax, hang out, and end our evening.
author: Samir P.

description: My friends and I were suppose to eat at Shalimar, but I had gotten there way too early and wandering around Tenderloin wasn't my idea of fun. So, I wandered into Nile Cafe where I struck up a conversation with two nice guys visiting from Oklahoma, and there you have it! I got to try my first hookah! Then I told my friends to join me there first before Shalimar. We had such a great time that after Shalimar, we came back and tried our own hookah. We're going to definitely come back and try their different blends. Their house tea is also quite yummy!
author: unhei k.

description: This place is money and the best hookah I have had in SF.  The price is great and the quality is par none.  I think the menu is going through some adjustments but the core of it is authentic and excellent.  The owner is hands down the nicest bar/restaurant owner I have ever met and I implore you to visit and prove me wrong.  Ask for the Nile mix on your hookah and you wont be disappointed.  Its small place with a lot of heart.  The ladies are starting to show up as well which was great to see.  If you hookah, you must stop by
author: Porfirio R.

description:
REALLY enjoyed this place. I'm not a huge hookah person, but this place had great ambience, and the staff was extremely friendly and nice. The clay pot filled with hot coals kept us warm outside, and the 'sex on the beach' flavor and the 'obama' flavored hookah were great. Afterwards we moved inside to an area where you sat on the floor, surrounded by totally comfy cushions. 
The TEA was the best part. I don't even like tea. And I definitely don't like cardamom flavored tea. But this was awesome ... we all had multiple little cups filled of this fragrant, sweet hot tea. 
The only reason this place is not getting 5 stars is that it doesn't serve food or alcoholic drinks. But they let you bring your own booze, which is fine in my books. There is a Turkish hole-in-the-wall joint next door, from which you can order your hummus/tabouleh/baba ganoush/etc and bring it over if you want ... next time we'll try that, and perhaps move it up to 5 stars :-)
author: Antara B.

description: This place serves the best hookah in San Francisco, without a doubt.  The owner is soooo nice and always helpful.  It is best to ask the owner to create a mix for you.  The tea is the perfect mixture with just the right amount of sugar and they have just expanded their menu (although I haven't had anything yet I know it will be good).  I love this place, my roommate and I try to come here at least once a week.  If you get here early enough you can get a great place to sit and study while you smoke.  I love love love his hookah, it is the best.  EVERYONE MUST COME HERE!!!
author: Kathleen O.

description: This is my favorite hookah place as of last night.  It's reasonably priced, they have GREAT flavors, and it's ridiculously chill.  There's no skeez and no pretention here, it's just plain simple hookah.
author: Rose H.

description: cool spot other than the location in smack middle of the tenderloin and having to put up with the lady upstairs screaming out of the window and pouring water out on the outside smokers. This place is cool.
author: Nael M.

description: really small but i liked the intimate atmosphere and although they didn't have half the things we wanted his suggestion for the hot coco was spot on ! plus the hookah was perfect:) the table was rickety so i was kinda scared I'd break it but I had fun
author: Cassandra P.

description: Best Hookah in TOWN! Good peops and really the best hookah. Beats Kan Zaman, Marakesh, Pride of Medeterian, Zyrabs. They take  care of their hookas and will make sure u have a good experience. Place is full of great random acts of after and pre party.
author: agil m.

description: Very small and intimate, I don't like the camera inside makes it feel like someone is watching every move. Friendly people but when we came here today we were the only ones and it just made us feel that our every move was being watched so we split and left but not before I ordered a green tea latte (which was very good I might say!). I guess it is better to come here on weekends? They have quite a selection of menu's in their hookah flavor tobacco's, a few names stood out like "obama" and  "sex on the beach".. I thought those cleaver names were in cocktail mixes only..I guess not. I might come back but not on a sloooow day like today.
author: Ateh M.

description: I enjoyed the nile cafe, good atmosphere, decent prices.. the only drawback is that the place is so small, I came with a small group and we had a bit of trouble finding a place to sit. I would go again, I had a great time.
author: Starr R.

description: I would add a couple of caveats to all the rave reviews below -- this is not a place to go in big groups neither is it a place to go with empty stomach. I would say though that this place seems to be a great joint for hookahs. We went there in a group of 9, we were given the biggest corner but it was   probably only big enough for 6 people. And did I tell you we were  hungry, but with the small table in center which was probably big enough to hold  food for two -- we gave up. The owner then ushered into a shop couple of doors away -- which was just a sequel to the disappointment that Nile Cafe was. Overall, if you are not there solely for the hookahs, pick a different place, drive to Haight, goto Kan Zamaan or some other place.
author: Kumar S.

description: Seriously best shisha in the area and nice warm hospitable owner:) oh not to forget Amleset, she gives the best of her to serve costumers! She is amazing with best tea she makes and best shisha:) trust me guys this place is worth the visit! There's also a good Turkish restnt nxt to it!
author: Invincible M.

description: Try the house special mint (blue mist - blueberry mint? and guava) hookah/shiesha/nargila.  The staff is nice, the shiesha flavors are plentiful and the location is great, right next to a bunch of halal restaurants.  Cushy seats, Arabic music, Egyptian TV. Love it!
author: Cara J.

description: I visit Nile Cafe about once a week for their amazing tea and hookah. The staff is helpful and knows how to prepare a mean (hookah) bowl. I also recommend the fresh baklava
author: Benjamin H.

description: A hooka/cafe joint located in the TL. Many hooka flavor to choose from I think the menu had 40+. Small place though probably 6 tables in there however the Thursday night that I went, nobody was there so we were fortunate enough to get a table. They have a plasma TV and since it is a coffee shop, you have your standard choice of drinks of latte, espresso, coffee, etc. Prices are fair but neighborhood ain't the best. I think it was a couple spaces away from a rehab center.  Since I went there for the hooka, I cannot speak for the food they serve there. I will go back but the neighborhood and sitting space are drawbacks.
author: Peter L.

description: The service here is AWFUL!!!!! First of all, the waiters took at least half an hour to finally acknowledge our existence and give us service (probably after realizing how persistent we were on staying to hookah) and one of them was even rude to say, I know I see you, after slowly cleaning up the empty table next to us while still keeping us waiting to order. tNext, after the long wait we decide to move up closer and thats when a waitress comes up to us and we order. We asked for watermelon mint and three chai lattes and a mocha. The waitress tells us we cant combine favors which turned out to be a lie because we overhear the table next to us ordering flavor combinations or possibly the waitress didn't understand her own menu. After over another half hour the waitress comes back with three chais that taste more like coffee and a white chocolate mocha after we specifically said not a white chocolate mocha, just a regular one. And finally, they even took their sweet time to give us the check. I could tell the patrons at the table by us were also getting frustrated as one of them told the waiter they were leaving if they didnt get their check at that precise moment. The incompetence and negligence I have observed at this hookah cafe was enough to assure that I will not be coming back. I have never witnessed such horrible service and if you dare to come, try to not come on a Saturday night because you will also most likely get frustrated.
author: Adriana R.

description: This place is awesome! So low-key, so chill and perfect place to smoke hookah. You should go on weeknights when its not very crowded and you'll get to sit on the floor in their nooks. Their mint tea is OFF THE HOOK. I think our group of 8 got like 15 pots of it last time. This place no longer serves food (Even though I heard their ethiopian food was amazing!) but you should still check it out....
author: Preeya J.

description: So this is where Saturday night got started. We weren't even suppose to come here. We wanted to go to Marrakech, but when we walked into Marrakech it was DEAD! Just some old men literally rubbing up against a scary looking stripper turned belly dancer. So we said screw this and went to Nile instead. I had been here once before and was not impressed- probably cause myself and my friend were the only ones in there. But this time I really had an awesome time. It was chill, but an upbeat chill! Lots of people having a good time. Had the house tea which I thought was alright. But I'm not the biggest tea drinker in the world anyways. In fact I've only started enjoying tea the last 6 months or so. The play list was also pretty cool. A nice mix of Arabic, Turkish and Indian pop. Also a little American pop, which can also be cool. You have to love it when Believing by Journey starts playing and everyone gets excited- some even sining along. For our shisha flavor we chose guava, which was pretty tasty and smooth. No joke a crack head came in and asked if he could "hit yo shit?." Nah foo, you cant hit my shit!
author: David D.

description:
The sheesha is definitely the best I have smoked in the bay, they keep their hookahs extremely clean, and the tobacco they use is very high-grade, really the best smoke I've had in the bay...

The downside for me (as a girl going with 2 other girls) was the overabundance of men gawking at us...this is obviously more of a boys hangout, or might even fly if you go there with a co-ed crowd, but honestly, me and my friends felt very uneasy...

There really isn't any food here (and the waiters didn't know what was on the menu anyway), just tea/cafe, etc. which is completely fine - just remember it's a place to go after dinner or for a snack, etc.

Anyway, loved the sheesha, didn't like the ambiance, but will probably return again with more of a mixed crowd rather than just all girls...
author: Rollio R.

description: Went to the Nile Cafe right after the St. Patrick's day parade. Originally we were going to go to Cairo Nights but despite the posted hours Cairo Nights was closed. So we went to the Nile Cafe and it was a much better choice. As we got there we were warmly greeted by our kind and courteous host Kume. We purchased guava flavored shisha and it was delicious. The coals that they use do not have any harsh undertones which is often common in hookah bars. Also Kume makes amazing smoothies and coffee drinks. Overall a truly nice experience.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Best Hookah In town...Only four stars because I do not live close enough.
Gotta try the blackberry!!!!
This is the spot to chill with friends after dinner or before/after a nice evening!
author: arch v.

description: Even though it can get a little cramped, this place has a good vibe to it. There's a portion of the cafe where one can recline. That's a killer combo with shisha and hot tea! Fun place to hang out with friends and catch up. Not to mention the good middle-eastern music playing in the backdrop.
author: Arnab B.
