description: not a bad place.  good prices.  hookah service was really fast (they keep a huge bowl of coals burning).  coals were maybe a little too hot though and hookah got a little rough.  lots of young people in the night time (i.e. under 21).  music was really loud.  not the most comfortable seating.  on the whole, pretty good bang for your buck
author: albert s.

description: very ghetto and scary late night.. we came to this place looking for a relaxing after hours spot, but instead were crowded around by a bunch of baggy clothed tweekers who were trying to rob us of our ugly girls we picked up from the club.. i mean this would have been a problem if they were good looking, so yea.. be careful who you bring here!
author: Jensen K.

description: One of the best cafes around. The owner is an especially friendly guy who goes out of his way to accommodate his customers.
author: Faisal G.

description: my review is perhaps influenced by the fact that i'm not necessarily interested in hookahs. the atmosphere, however, was delightful - mostly because there were pillows everywhere. it took a while for our hookah to get started up, but the flavor selection had a nice, large, tasty-looking variety.
author: Jamie C.

description: I Love this place! This place is really chill if you just ever want to relax sit down and smoke. I went here for the first time with my friend and we got the Peach flavored tobacco as well as the House Tea and they were both soooo amazing! The tea is really sweet and gingery and the Peach is really nice and soft. They had a range of flavors to choose from and I had no idea what to pick. Some of the mixed flavors they had were really interesting: Obama and Sex on the Beach...Anyway this place is really small but it is so chill, you have hookah and some nice tea(great combo btw!) and some really cool arabic/bollywood music. My friend and i came here pretty early and so we had seats to ourselves for 2 hours and it was nice. The waiter was also very nice and helpful. I find the prices are a bit pricey tho and that is one thing that bothers me. I am also really shocked that they didn't even card me or my friend, but oh well. I will definitely go back to this place late at night or in the very early morning if i just want to relax from partying or if im just chillin out with buddies. I recommend this place!
author: Clementine D.

description: When you want a low key evening hanging out with your friends, look no further than Nile Cafe.   It's a cozy place where you can relax and enjoy a hookah while watching Middle Eastern and Indian music videos.  I love the tobacco mixes here.  They are light and smooth.  I've had the apple mint and the Nile Mix 1 which is fantastic (if you like a fruity flavor).   You should also definitely get a pot of the house tea.  It makes a perfect complement to the tobacco and has just the right sweetness.
author: Roy L.

description: Honestly, I am no hookah specialist but I know what good tobacco taste like and it's Nile Cafe. The environment is outstanding and the service is great, the tea is amazing and the manager or maybe he's the owner made my visit here very welcoming! I loved my visit here and will return again when I come back to the bay!!
author: Mai H.

description: We went to this place yesterday with my family and we ordered two hookahs ( one mint and one jasmin mint) and one teapot of arabic tea, and the bill came out as $60!! Secondly, the service was horrible, the hookahs were served inside since outiside was cold and there was something wrong with their heat lamp. There are so many cons about this place that I do not know where to begin with. The place had these round little cylinders that were lightly covered with blankets as chairs, that were good and fancy, but not even in the same zip code as comfortable! The atmosphere gave me a very bad headache since they were burning the coals inside and they left it on a spinner next to the wall and every 30 minutes they would add new coals to your hooka. They had this small plasma tv that was relatively fit in comparison to the size of their "cafe" that played a previously-recorded DVD on a loop of some of arabic music videos, the music was loud and when we politely asked him to turn it a little down, he just frowned in the most unprofessional manner for a business owner and blatantly ignored us. They also had this group of the owner's friends who had a VIP lounge and were telling jokes to each other as loud as a PA system! It was like a radio Al jazeera that you couldn't turn off! The place was dirty and the the music was on a loop, and what's worse is that they don't ID you for hookah, this place should be reported to the police because they serve tobacco to underaged minors, I saw at least 8 arabic minors who were friendly with the owner receive hookahs, and I'm very sure one of them slipped some marijuana in it because the we could all smell it very well, Nile Cafe very professionally turned our great night around and made the entire experience in the city bitterly unpleasant. I do not recommend this place if it was the last cafe on earth.
author: Aryo A.

description: i heart you nile cafe. thank you for being open late and having the best & smoothest hookah flavors evar. amazing...!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Very intimate classy sheesha joint. The best Sheesha in the Bay. The mint tea is like heaven.The owner is extremely friendly  and willing to bend over backwards to help us with our needs.  Great place to chill out after a hard day of work.   The place can be busy all week long. I remember one Monday it was packed!..so it might be wise to get there early to truly enjoy the ambiance.
author: Naa N.

description: This was my first hookah experience and I must say, I was very pleased. The patrons were very friendly and answered all of my questions. The cafe is nice and small, and wasn't too crowded. Even though I know nothing about Hookah's or Hookah bars, the product was very tasty and lasted over an hour for 2 people. The Arabic teas was delicious. The music was also fantastic. If there was one bad thing I had to say about this place, it would be that seemed a tad bit expensive, but then again, what isn't these days? I'll be sure to return many more times in the future.
author: Dane K.

description: I have never been so disrespected as a customer before in my life. If you want to be treated like trash as soon as you walk in, then give this place a try. I feel like if I go into detail about my experience it will be giving them more credit than they deserve. Two thumbs down......
author: EGYPTO H.
